Aston Villa will listen to offers for 24-year-old former England Under-21 defender Ezri Konsa.

Atletico Madrid are considering a move for Napoli and Italy right-back Giovanni di Lorenzo, 28, as the Spanish champions look for a permanent replacement for 31-year-old England defender Kieran Trippier, who left for Newcastle in January.

Real Madrid believe they can afford the financial packages needed to sign Paris St-Germain and France striker Kylian Mbappe, 23, and Borussia Dortmund and Norway forward Erling Braut Haaland, 21, this summer.
Newcastle are keen on signing Chelsea and Spain goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, 27, in the summer with the Blues prepared to listen to offers around the Â£50m mark.

Meanwhile, Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley says Lille's 22-year-old Dutch defender Sven Botman and Manchester United's England midfielder Jesse Lingard, 29, both wanted to join the Tyneside club in January.
However, Tottenham want to beat Newcastle to the signing of Botman to convince manager Antonio Conte that the club will back him.
West Ham boss David Moyes says he spoke to Colombia forward Luis Diaz as the Hammers tried to sign the 25-year-old before he joined Liverpool.
Barcelona lead Bayern Munich in the race to sign Chelsea's 25-year-old Danish defender Andreas Christensen.
Leicester are plotting a move for Chelsea's 19-year-old English defender Levi Colwill who is on loan at Huddersfield.
Real Sociedad and Sweden striker Alexander Isak, 22, is favouring a switch to Barcelona over a move to Arsenal in the summer.
Manchester United are monitoring PSV Eindhoven and Netherlands striker Cody Gakpo, 22, and Sporting Lisbon and Portugal defensive midfielder Joao Palhinha, 26.
Barcelona are planning a move to sign Manchester United centre-back Eric Bailly, with the 27-year-old Ivory Coast international struggling for first-team football at Old Trafford.
English striker Ashley Fletcher, 26, who joined Watford last summer, is set to join Major League Soccer side New York Red Bulls on loan.
Wolves defender Max Kilman, 24, is in contention to be called up by England manager Gareth Southgate for two friendlies in March.
Inter Miami will "push" to sign Argentina forward Lionel Messi if the 34-year-old decides to leave Paris St-Germain, says the co-owner of the Major League Soccer side.
Poland striker Robert Lewandowski's contract with Bayern Munich ends in 2023 and, while the 33-year-old wants a new deal with the German club, no talks have taken place.

Borussia Dortmund and Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland has not agreed to join Real Madrid in the summer, according to the 21-year-old's compatriot and former Middlesbrough forward Jan Aage Fjortoft.
Barcelona hope to be in the race to sign Haaland this summer when the striker's release clause of 75m euros (Â£62.6m) is activated.
Barcelona are moving closer to signing Ivory Coast midfielder Franck Kessie on a free transfer in the summer when the 25-year-old's contract with AC Milan runs out.
Newcastle United missed out on signing Dutch defender Sven Botman in January and the 22-year-old, who has also been linked with Tottenham, is expected to join AC Milan in the summer.
Andreas Christensen has called his situation at Chelsea "difficult", with the 25-year-old Denmark defender's contract with the Blues ending in the summer.
Chelsea are considering a move to re-sign Belgium forward Eden Hazard, 31, from Real Madrid, while Leeds United's Brazil winger Raphinha also remains of interest.

Marcelo Bielsa's sacking as Leeds manager could see Manchester United move for the club's 26-year-old England midfielder Kalvin Phillips - though West Ham's Declan Rice, 23, remains one of their top targets.
Manchester United interim manager Ralf Rangnick wants the club to sign 24-year-old French defender Nordi Mukiele from RB Leipzig.
Sporting Lisbon's Portuguese defender Goncalo Inacio has agreed a new contract at the club. The 20-year-old attracted the interest of Newcastle United in January.
Real Sociedad and Atalanta are interested in a loan deal for 26-year-old Greece left-back Dimitris Giannoulis from Norwich City.
Former Manchester United midfielder Roy Keane has told the club to appoint Atletico Madrid's Argentine boss Diego Simeone.
Manchester United are not prepared to pay Â£100m to sign 23-year-old Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen from Napoli.
Manchester United have also shown interest in Sporting Lisbon's 26-year-old Portuguese midfielder Joao Palhinha, having sent scouts to watch him eight times already this season.
Newcastle are monitoring Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga with a view to making a move for the 27-year-old Spaniard.
David Beckham's MLS franchise Inter Miami will do everything they can to sign Lionel Messi, should the 34-year-old Argentina international look to leave Paris St-Germain as early as this season.
Real Madrid are keen to finalise a deal to sign France forward Kylian Mbappe, 23, from PSG before they pursue other transfer targets or offer contract extensions to current players.
Arsenal target Jonathan David is determined to leave Lille this summer, handing the Gunners the perfect incentive to strike a deal for the Canada international forward, 22, at the end of the season.
England winger Bukayo Saka is "really happy" at Arsenal despite reports suggesting that the 20-year-old has put his contract talks on hold.

Nottingham Forest have opened contract talks with English midfielder Ryan Yates, 24, as they also battle to keep in-demand 20-year-old Welsh midfielder Brennan Johnson, who has been linked with Tottenham.
LA Galaxy are interested in signing veteran Spanish centre-back Sergio Ramos, 35, who has struggled to make an impact at Paris St-Germain because of fitness issues.
Ajax want to appoint Barcelona sporting advisor Jordi Cruyff as their new director of football after Marc Overmars' departure.
Barcelona have almost completed the free signing of AC Milan and Ivory Coast midfielder Franck Kessie, 25.
Crystal Palace have made an inquiry about Real Madrid's former Arsenal midfielder Dani Ceballos, 25.
Juventus are leading the race for 22-year-old Italy winger Nicolo Zaniolo, who is stalling on signing a new Roma contract.
Juventus are also hopeful of keeping Spain striker Alvaro Morata, 29, at the club beyond his current loan spell from Atletico Madrid.
Manchester City's record signing Jack Grealish, 26, should ignore public opinion when he returns to action from injury, says manager Pep Guardiola.
Chelsea have the most profitable football academy in the Premier League according to a new study that shows the club generated Â£175m from player sales in recent years.
Manchester City have held talks with the agent of Borussia Dortmund's 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland.
Dortmund have not given up hope of keeping Haaland beyond the summer transfer window, despite Barcelona also showing interest.
Chelsea could look to sell Albania forward Armando Broja, 20, and English midfielder Faustino Anjorin, 20, to help fund transfers this summer.
The representatives of Chelsea's Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, 28, are in constant dialogue with Real Madrid and PSG.
A deal to take Chelsea's Denmark defender Andreas Christensen, 25, to Barcelona is at an advanced stage.
Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich could be open to selling the club, with bids expected to arrive this week.
Interim boss Ralf Rangnick has been largely ruled out of taking permanent charge at Manchester United.
Arsenal will look to reward England forward Bukayo Saka, 20, with a contract extension on improved terms at the end of the season.
Arsenal's French midfielder Matteo Guendouzi will join loan club Marseille on a permanent deal for Â£9m at the end of the season.
Football director John Murtough says a "thorough" process is under way to identify Manchester United's next permanent manager.
Borussia Dortmund are interested in Chelsea's 25-year-old Germany forward Timo Werner.
Bayern Munich's Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, is yet to make a decision on his future but says he is "open to anything".
Arsenal have joined the race to sign Lewandowski.
Barcelona are keen to sign Monaco's 22-year-old France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni.
Former Spain striker Diego Costa, 33, is close to joining Brazilian club Corinthians.
Former Liverpool goalkeeper David James thinks Republic of Ireland keeper Caoimhin Kelleher, 23, could leave Anfield to make a name for himself elsewhere.
But Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he will only let Kelleher leave on loan.
Leicester City and Brighton are monitoring 16-year-old Millwall forward Zak Lovelace.
Real Madrid's Italian manager Carlo Ancelotti, 62, has emerged as a surprise candidate to become the next Manchester United boss.
Ajax boss Erik ten Hag, who has been linked with becoming Manchester United manager, has been having English lessons in preparation of a possible move to the Premier League this summer.
Colombia and former Everton midfielder James Rodriguez, 30, has put the Toffees on alert after hinting at a possible return to the club from Qatar.
Paris St-Germain are set to offer 23-year-old forward Kylian Mbappe a new deal worth Â£799,000 per week to remain at the club, with Real Madrid also interested in signing the France international.
Bayern Munich, Tottenham and Arsenal are all interested in signing Middlesbrough's English right-back Djed Spence, 21, who is currently on loan at Nottingham Forest.
However both Tottenham and Arsenal, along with Liverpool, are also considering a bid for Torino's Ivorian right-back Wilfried Singo, 21, who would be available for Â£15m.

Real Madrid have decided to sell 30-year-old Spain right-back Dani Carvajal, with Manchester United's 22-year-old Portugal defender Diogo Dalot and Norwich City's English full-back Max Aarons, 22, on a list of possible replacements.

Barcelona are hoping to convince Chelsea and Denmark defender Andreas Christensen, 25, and his 32-year-old club team-mate Cesar Azpilicueta of Spain to join on free transfers at the end of the season.
Barcelona are close to securing Uruguay defender Ronald Araujo, 22, and 17-year-old Spain midfielder Gavi on new deals with the club.
Spain winger Bryan Gil says he struggled with the physicality of the Premier League after his move to Tottenham from Sevilla last summer. The 21-year-old joined Valencia on loan in January.
Nottingham Forest boss Steve Cooper says Wales attacking midfielder Brennan Johnson, 20, won't be distracted by contract talks or growing Premier League interest.
Irish UFC star Conor McGregor, 33, has indicated his interest in buying Chelsea after owner Roman Abramovich said he was planning to sell the club.
West Ham and Celtic are interested in signing Bristol City's 22-year-old English striker Antoine Semenyo, who is expected to cost about Â£15m.
Paris St-Germain's Argentine boss Mauricio Pochettino, who has been linked with the managerial job at Manchester United, is reportedly keen to return to his old job as Tottenham manager.
Barcelona are yet to decide if they will offer to keep 26-year-old Spain winger Adama Traore on a permanent deal at the end of the season when his loan spell from Wolves expires.

Manager Thomas Tuchel is concerned Chelsea will lose out-of-contract defenders Cesar Azpilicueta, Antonio Rudiger and Andreas Christensen amid the uncertainty at the club after owner Roman Abramovich put the Blues up for sale. Spain's Azpilicueta, 32, has been linked with Barcelona, while Borussia Dortmund are interested in 25-year-old Dane Christensen, while Manchester United are reportedly keen on Germany international Rudiger, 29.

Manchester United have asked the representatives of Robert Lewandowski to keep them informed of the Poland striker's future at Bayern Munich, with Bavarian club reportedly trying to line up Borussia Dortmund's Erling Braut Haaland as the 33-year-old's successor.
Borussia Dortmund could sign Real Madrid striker Luka Jovic, 24, as a replacement for Haaland, 21, if the star leaves this summer.

Haaland's agent Mino Raiola has reportedly told Barcelona that they also have to sign another of his clients, Ajax's 24-year-old Morocco right-back Noussair Mazraoui, to maximise their chances of signing the Norwegian.
Everton are bracing for offers to come in for 24-year-old England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin and Brazilian forward Richarlison, 24, in the summer.
Arsenal's 20-year-old Brazilian forward Gabriel Martinelli has said that he wants to stay for the Gunners his "whole life" and is determined to help them reach the Champions League.
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says nothing has changed with his contract situation, with his deal due to run out in 2024.
Armando Broja could move to the other side of London with West Ham understood to be willing to pay Â£25m for the 20-year-old Albania forward, who is currently on loan at Southampton from Chelsea.
Sevilla will not attempt to keep Manchester United's 26-year-old France forward Anthony Martial beyond his loan stay which expires at the end of the season.
West Ham's 23-year-old England midfielder Declan Rice, who has long been linked with Chelsea and Manchester United, has described the Â£100m price tag attached to him by the Hammers as "crazy".
Arsenal have reportedly asked about the possibility of signing Napoli's Spain midfielder Fabian Ruiz, 25, this summer.

Marseille president Pablo Longoria has said he wants to keep on-loan French defender William Saliba at the club beyond the end of his loan stay from Arsenal at the end of the season, putting pressure on Gunners boss Mikel Arteta to make a decision about the 20-year-old's future.
Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe wants English midfielder Sean Longstaff to sign the contract extension the club have offered him. The the 24-year-old's current deal runs out in the summer.

Arsenal have been linked with a move for 21-year-old Peru defender Jhilmar Lora, who plays in his native country for Club Sporting Cristal, as the Gunners look to South America for recruits in the summer.
Juventus have contacted Paul Pogba's agent Mino Raiola about the possibility of the Manchester United midfielder returning to Turin as a free agent in the summer.

Pogba would have to accept a pay cut if he returned to Juve, who see their pursuit of the World Cup winner as a difficult one with Paris St-Germain and Real Madrid also in the race for the 28-year-old France international.
West Ham are keen to sign Belgium Under-21s midfielder Amadou Onana from Lille, who want more than Â£20m for the 20-year-old.

Atletico Madrid are considering a move for Paris St-Germain's 31-year-old Netherlands midfielder Gini Wijnaldum, who is said to be considering his future in the French capital less than one year into a three-year deal.
Manchester United are considering Southampton boss Ralph Hasenhuttl as their potential next manager.

Chelsea's Danish defender Andreas Christensen, 25, has turned down approaches from rival Premier League clubs and is close to agreeing a deal with Barcelona, who have tabled a better offer than Bayern Munich.

Barcelona boss Xavi Hernandez is said to be confident the club will win the race to sign 21-year-old Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Braut Haaland, with the Spanish manager refusing to deny that he flew to Germany to meet the Norway international last week.

Lazio manager Maurizio Sarri is keen on being reunited with Chelsea's 27-year-old goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga in Rome, with the ex-Blues boss identifying the Spaniard as a loan target for the summer.

Leeds could make a bid to sign Manchester United's 20-year-old midfielder James Garner in the summer, while Southampton are also keeping a close eye on the England Under-21s international who is on loan at Nottingham Forest.
Arsenal and Newcastle United are interested in Sevilla's 24-year-old Morocco forward Youssef En-Nesyri, who was linked with a move to Manchester United in January.
Manchester United manager Ralf Rangnick wants to sign RB Leipzig's French forward Christopher Nkunku. The 24-year-old was Rangnick's first signing when he managed the German club.
England midfielder Bukayo Saka has no desire to leave Arsenal, despite Liverpool showing interest in the 20-year-old.

Real Sociedad's Swedish 22-year-old Alexander Isak, and Everton's England international Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 24, have been named as possible targets for Arsenal after Gunners boss Mikel Arteta said a striker will be his priority transfer target this summer.
Bayer Leverkusen will want a club-record fee of about 100m euros for 22-year-old France winger Moussa Diaby, who is wanted by Newcastle.
Crystal Palace have joined Manchester United, Newcastle and West Ham in the race to sign 22-year-old French midfielder Boubacar Kamara from Marseille.
Wales defender Joe Rodon, 24, is considering quitting Tottenham in the summer after struggling for opportunities under boss Antonio Conte.

Czech Republic midfielder Alex Kral has been linked with a move to French Ligue 1 side Montpellier next season, with West Ham unlikely to take up the option to buy the 23-year-old when his loan from Spartak Moscow expires in the summer.
Aston Villa are keeping tabs on Paris St-Germain midfielder Georginio Wijnaldum and have been told the 31-year-old Netherlands international will cost Â£21m.

Striker Luis Suarez will leave Atletico Madrid at the end of his contract in the summer, and Italian champions Inter Milan as well as Ajax, Sevilla and un-named clubs in Brazil are keen to recruit the 35-year-old Uruguay international.
Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick says he has not spoken to the club about who their next manager should be but described Ajax boss Erik ten Hag as "one of the top coaches in Europe".
Newcastle United are ready to table a Â£50m offer for Bayer Leverkusen winger Moussa Diaby, 22, which falls short of the German club's valuation of the France international at about Â£75m.

Paris St-Germain are interested in re-signing Everton striker Moise Kean, who is on loan at Juventus until the summer of 2023. While the Turin club have an obligation to buy the 22-year-old Italy international, the Bianconeri and Kean himself are said to be keen to end the arrangement.

Barcelona president Joan Laporta has denied that the club has started negotiations with Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Braut Haaland, and added that any meeting between manager Xavi Hernandez and the 21-year-old Norway international is "none of my business".

Thomas Ricketts, owner of Major League Baseball team Chicago Cubs, and property billionaire Nick Candy are reportedly the latest to emerge as potential Chelsea buyers after Blues owner Roman Abramovich put the European champions up for sale.
Up to 10 bidders, a majority of which are American-based parties, are said to be considering making offers for Chelsea.

Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says the club will meet with France striker Alexandre Lacazette at the end of the season to discuss the 30-year-old's future. Lacazette's deal with the Gunners runs out in the summer.
Atletico Madrid, Barcelona, Inter Milan and Tottenham are interested in 28-year-old Argentine forward Paulo Dybala, whose contract at Juventus runs out in the summer.
Lautaro Martinez's agent Alejandro Camano appears to have ended speculation that the Argentine could move to Arsenal, saying the 24-year-old striker will stay at the San Siro.
Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign 18-year-old midfielder Toby Collyer after the former England Under-17 international failed to agree new terms with Brighton.
West Ham have made a "concrete" approach for Udinese's 27-year-old Spain forward Gerard Deulofeu, who has also been linked to a potential return to AC Milan.
Valencia manager Jose Bordalas has said Tottenham's 21-year-old Spain winger Bryan Gil "would be welcome" to stay with the club beyond his loan, which expires in the summer.
Wigan Athletic and Blackburn Rovers are said to be monitoring 18-year-old striker Josh Stones, who plays in England's sixth tier with National League North side Guiseley.
Inter Milan have contacted the agent of 28-year-old Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, whose Juventus contract is set to expire at the end of the season.

Manchester United's Portugal striker Cristiano Ronaldo, 37, will target a move to Paris St-Germain - which could see him link up with Argentina forward Lionel Messi - if United fail to qualify for next season's Champions League.
Arsenal, Newcastle and West Ham are monitoring 24-year-old England forward Marcus Rashford, who is believed to be considering his future at Manchester United.

Paris St-Germain will attempt to sign Manchester United's Rashford if 23-year-old France striker Kylian Mbappe joins Real Madrid. PSG explored the possibility of signing Rashford last summer but United were not prepared to sell.

Manchester City and Real Madrid are the two frontrunners to sign Borussia Dortmund's Erling Braut Haaland despite interest from Bayern Munich and Barcelona. The 21-year-old Norway striker's future is expected to be decided in the "next few weeks".

New York Jets owner Robert Wood Johnson is preparing a bid to buy Chelsea. Johnson is considered to be "very knowledgeable" of the club and the Premier League having lived in London during his time as the United States' ambassador to the UK.
Private consortium Saudi Media have also made contact with American firm Raine Group, who are managing the sale of Chelsea, about buying the club from Roman Abramovich.
Newcastle have opened talks with Real Madrid over a move for Belgium playmaker Eden Hazard, 31, who is expected to leave in the summer.
England striker Harry Kane, 28, needs to leave Tottenham if he wants to challenge for football's major trophies, according to former Spurs and Manchester United forward Teddy Sheringham.
Chelsea's Denmark centre-back Andreas Christensen, 25, has agreed to join Barcelona on a free transfer in the summer when his contract runs out.
Barcelona president Joan Laporta says letting Argentina forward Lionel Messi, 34, leave last summer was the "saddest decision of all" but does not regret it.
Arsenal are ready to challenge Paris St-Germain for Brazil attacking midfielder Lucas Paqueta, 24, from Lyon.
Brazilian forward Gabriel Martinelli, 20, says he wants to stay at Arsenal and fight for trophies amid interest from Liverpool.
Chelsea and Manchester City are monitoring RB Leipzig's French midfielder Christopher Nkunku. The 24-year-old would cost about Â£62m.
Some Manchester United players have derided interim manager Ralf Rangnick's CV and are dissatisfied with the German's methods.
Spanish midfielder Juan Mata, 33, will leave Manchester United as a free agent in the summer and is attracting interest from clubs in La Liga.

Middlesbrough's 21-year-old English right-back Djed Spence, who has impressed during his loan spell at Nottingham Forest, is attracting interest from seven Premier League clubs, including Manchester City and Tottenham, two Spanish clubs and Bundesliga sides Bayern Munich and RB Leipzig.
Arsenal players could get bonuses worth up to Â£500,000 each if they manage to secure a place in the Champions League by finishing in the top four in the Premier League.
Newcastle United are interested in signing Germany defender Antonio Rudiger when the 29-year-old's Chelsea contract expires at the end of the season.
But Manchester United will rival their fellow Premier League side for Rudiger's signature this summer.
United, however, could miss out on signing the centre-back because of the uncertainty over who will become the next manager at Old Trafford.
Arsenal could attempt to re-sign Germany winger Serge Gnabry from Bayern Munich, with the 26-year-old - who spent four years with the Gunners - valued at Â£63m.
Tottenham are prepared to listen to offers for 23-year-old Brazilian defender Emerson Royal, less than a year after his Â£26m move from Barcelona.
Borussia Dortmund's 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland wants to join Barcelona this summer.
However, Barcelona president Joan Laporta has denied reports that negotiations are already under way to sign Haaland, who is also wanted by Manchester City and Real Madrid.
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp wants to sign Borussia Dortmund's Jude Bellingham and believes the 18-year-old England international will go on to become the best midfielder in the world.
Manchester United expect 37-year-old Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo to leave this summer and are lining up Everton's Brazil international Richarlison, 24, as his replacement.
Aston Villa are ready to exercise their option to turn Philippe Coutinho's loan from Barcelona into a permanent deal after being impressed with the 29-year-old Brazil forward's recent performances.
Andreas Christensen's agents are in Spain to seal a move to Barcelona. The 25-year-old Denmark defender will join on a five-year deal when his Chelsea contract expires at the end of the season.
Roma will make a move for Manchester United's Portugal full-back Diogo Dalot, 22, this summer.
England striker Harry Kane, 28, has told team-mates he will stay at Tottenham next season if Champions League football is secured and Antonio Conte remains as manager.
Liverpool will have the chance to sign Red Bull Salzburg's 20-year-old German striker Karim Adeyemi in the summer transfer window, but could face competition from Borussia Dortmund.
Paris St-Germain and Chelsea are interested in signing Manchester City's Algeria winger Riyad Mahrez, 31.
RB Leipzig have joined the race to sign Real Madrid's 19-year-old Spanish defender Rafa Marin.
Manchester United will have to pay up to 80m euros (Â£66m) to sign Serbia midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, 27, from Lazio as a replacement for France midfielder Paul Pogba, 28.
Former Arsenal winger Perry Groves says the Gunners should target Everton and England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 24, at the end of the season.
Everton face a wage crisis if they suffer relegation to the Championship.
Manchester United and Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo, 37, has held talks with his agent Jorge Mendes over his future at Old Trafford.
Bayern Munich's 33-year-old Poland striker Robert Lewandowski is attracting the attention of Manchester United.
Lyon striker Moussa Dembele is another striker Manchester United are looking at, with the 25-year-old Frenchman reportedly available for Â£25m in the summer.

Aston Villa boss Steven Gerrard wants the club to exercise their option to sign Philippe Coutinho for 40m euros (Â£33.5m). However, the 29-year-old Brazilian, who has impressed during his loan spell from Barcelona, must cut his Â£480,000-a-week wages to join the Premier League side.

Villa may also target England midfielder Kalvin Phillips if Leeds are relegated to the Championship. The Villa board have discussed a move for the 26-year-old and the recruitment team are keen on him.
Atletico Madrid are interested in signing 23-year-old Brazilian defender Emerson Royal from Tottenham.

Juventus are set to decide whether to offer Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, 28, a contract extension or push to bring France midfielder Paul Pogba back to the club having sold the 28-year-old to Manchester United in 2016.
Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel has urged his Danish defender Andreas Christensen, 25, to turn down Barcelona and remain at Stamford Bridge.

Tottenham could offer 25-year-old American defender Cameron Carter-Vickers - who is on loan at Celtic - or England midfielder Harry Winks, 26, to Southampton as part of a deal to bring 19-year-old English defender Tino Livramento to Spurs.

Paris St-Germain are interested in signing Barcelona centre-back Ronald Araujo, who is yet to commit his future to the Catalan club. Both Manchester United and Chelsea also remain interested in the 23-year-old Uruguayan.
England left-back Luke Shaw, 26, is keen to sign a new deal at Manchester United.

Arsenal have made signing two strikers and a midfielder a priority as part of a possible major squad overhaul this summer. The Gunners may also target a new winger, left-sided centre-back and right-back.

Sevilla have increased Diego Carlos' release clause to 80 million euros (Â£67m). Newcastle tried to sign the 28-year-old Brazilian in January but the Spanish side were not prepared to sell the defender.

Atletico Madrid are frontrunners to sign Marseille's highly rated French midfielder Boubacar Kamara. Manchester United and Newcastle have also been linked with the 22-year-old, but Atletico are favourites to secure his services on a free transfer this summer.
Spain winger Bryan Gil, 21, could stay at Valencia next season after joining the Spanish club on loan from Tottenham in January.
Dutch midfielder Ryan Gravenberch, 19, is open to joining Barcelona from Ajax this summer.
Manchester City have a deal in place to sign Borussia Dortmund and Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21.
Manchester United hope to name their new permanent manager by the end of April.
The Red Devils have made enquiries about signing Lyon's French forward Moussa Dembele, 25, in the summer transfer window.
Paris St-Germain are set to sack manager Mauricio Pochettino but it is unclear whether they will do it now or wait until the end of the season.
Real Madrid are interested in a move for Arsenal and Scotland defender Kieran Tierney after assessing the 24-year-old in recent weeks.
France and Paris St-Germain striker Kylian Mbappe, 23, could sign a deal with Real Madrid within the next week.
Arsenal could allow up to 13 players to leave during the summer transfer window.
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club will make a decision on whether to offer French striker Alexandre Lacazette, 30, a new contract at the end of the season.

Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah, 29, has no intention of signing the contract extension offered to him by the club in December. The Egypt international is out of contract in 2023 but talks are currently at a standstill.
Salah's agent has appeared to mock claims by club manager Jurgen Klopp that Liverpool "cannot do much more" in the negotiations.
The Reds are ready to bid for Lille and Canada forward Jonathan David, 22.

Manchester United and England winger Jadon Sancho, 21, has revealed that players from Chelsea and Liverpool tried to convince him to join their clubs before he signed for the Red Devils for Â£73m in July last year.
Southampton defenders Jan Bednarek, 25, and Mohammed Salisu, 22, are targets for Napoli.
Juventus are looking into the possibility of signing 29-year-old Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, whose contract at Chelsea runs out in the summer.
Juventus are also monitoring the future of Paris St-Germain and Italy goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma, 23.
Tottenham manager Antonio Conte says he would consider extending his contract if the club shows "good vision".
Barcelona have denied Tottenham have a clause in place that would allow them to sign Brazilian playmaker Philippe Coutinho for the same fee as Aston Villa, where the 29-year-old is currently on loan.
Aston Villa boss Steven Gerrard says signing Coutinho permanently is "not as straight forward as people think".
The owners of Manchester City are keen on the signing of Atletico Minerio's Brazilian winger Savio, with a view to placing the 17-year-old with one of the City Football Group's clubs.

Crystal Palace's on-loan midfielder Conor Gallagher says he has not given any thought to his future beyond the end of the season. The England international, 22, has impressed at Selhurst Park where he is on loan from Chelsea.
Inter Milan are looking into the option of extending the contract of 33-year-old Chile forward Alexis Sanchez.
Chelsea's Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, is willing to take a pay cut to facilitate a return to Inter Milan on loan.
Lukaku has been angered by suggestions he is trying to exploit the uncertainty at Chelsea over the sanctions on Roman Abramovich and has said he has no intention of leaving the club.
Juventus are targeting moves for Chelsea's two Italy internationals - midfielder Jorginho, 30, and left-back Emerson Palmieri, 27, who is currently on loan at Lyon.

Barcelona are also monitoring the Chelsea situation and are interested in two of their Spain internationals - left-back Marcos Alonso, 31, and right-back Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, who is out of contract in the summer.
Arsenal and France striker Alexandre Lacazette, 30, is being targeted by Barcelona as an alternative to Borussia Dortmund's 21-year-old Norwegian striker Erling Braut Haaland.

Saudi Media's bid to buy Chelsea includes plans to redevelop Stamford Bridge and renew the contracts of players such as Azpilicueta and Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, 29, whose current deal is also set to expire this summer.
Egypt forward Mohamed Salah, 29, wants to stay in the Premier League if he cannot agree a new contract with Liverpool.
Manchester United have entered the race to sign Real Sociedad's Sweden striker Alexander Isak, 22.
Paul Pogba's personal trainer says the France midfielder, 28, will leave Manchester United when his contract expires at the end of the season.
Newcastle are in talks with English midfielder Sean Longstaff, who is out of contract in the summer, over a new long-term deal for the 24-year-old.
Newcastle are set to rival Aston Villa for the signing of 26-year-old Leeds and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips.

Manchester United could make a move to bring Sam Johnstone back from West Brom in the summer, although Tottenham and Southampton are also interested in signing the 28-year-old England goalkeeper, who is set to become a free agent.
Chelsea will do a U-turn to sign on-loan Spain midfielder Saul Niguez, 27, from Atletico Madrid this summer - if UK government sanctions allow them to.
Chelsea have pleaded with the government to lift the ban on them extending player contracts amid fears it could leave them with a major defensive crisis next season.
Manchester United have been alerted to the possibility of Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel becoming available at the end of the season.
Ajax coach Erik ten Hag is ready to become Manchester United manager - and is open to having interim boss Ralf Rangnick alongside him on the bench.
Real Madrid want to keep Croatia midfielder Luka Modric, who is set to become a free agent, for at least another season but the 36-year-old is yet to sign a new contract.
AC Milan have reached an agreement with Lille to sign 24-year-old Portugal midfielder Renato Sanches in the summer.
Juan Mata could be offered a coaching role at Manchester United - if the Spanish midfielder, 33, retires when his contract expires this summer.
Aston Villa have the option to buy on-loan Brazil forward Philippe Coutinho, but Arsenal are interested in signing the 29-year-old from Barcelona this summer.

Erling Braut Haaland's priority this summer is a move to Spain with Real Madrid or Barcelona, despite reports claiming the 21-year-old Norway and Borussia Dortmund striker has a deal in place to join Manchester City.
Barcelona president Joan Laporta says they will not sign Borussia Dortmund's Erling Braut Haaland this summer if the transfer risks putting the club in financial danger.
Barcelona are keen to sign on-loan Spain winger Adama Traore, 26, on a permanent deal from Wolves in the summer and could offer Spanish midfielder Riqui Puig, 22, as part of the deal.

Chelsea's Spain defender Cesar Azpilicueta, who has been linked with Barcelona, is not free to leave this summer when his deal was set to run out because a renewal clause in the 32-year-old's contract has been triggered.

Scouts from Manchester United, Liverpool and Newcastle have been watching Bayer Leverkusen's 18-year-old Germany midfielder Florian Wirtz, but he has suffered a serious knee injury that will keep him out for the rest of the season.
Argentina winger Angel di Maria, 33, wants to leave Paris St-Germain this summer and could make a return to Benfica.
Coach Mauricio Pochettino and France striker Kylian Mbappe, 23, are set to lead the high-profile exits from Paris St-Germain this summer.
Zinedine Zidane has been tipped to replace Mauricio Pochettino as PSG coach and is looking at making signings from former club Real Madrid, including 30-year-old Brazil midfielder Casemiro.
Chile midfielder Arturo Vidal, 34, looks set to leave Inter Milan this summer, with Flamengo interested in taking him back to South America.
Juventus are willing to sell France midfielder Adrien Rabiot, 26, this summer.
Roma are planning a summer bid for Barcelona's 21-year-old USA defender Sergino Dest.
The use of five substitutes in the Premier League could be re-introduced from the start of next season, with a vote on the issue expected in June.
Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard is monitoring Atletico Madrid's Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, 35, with the prospect of making a move this summer.
Manchester United are considering a fresh summer move for Tottenham's 28-year-old England striker Harry Kane.
Lionel Messi's father and agent Jorge has called Barcelona to discuss whether the 34-year-old Argentina forward can return after leaving last summer for Paris St-Germain.
Barcelona will consider a move for Chelsea's Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, if they cannot sign Borussia Dortmund's Norway forward Erling Braut Haaland this summer.
Barcelona manager Xavi is keen on the versatility that Liverpool's Egypt striker Mohamed Salah, 29, would add to his side.
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta and Tottenham boss Antonio Conte are on a nine-man shortlist for the Paris St-Germain job if Mauricio Pochettino is sacked.
AC Milan believe Lille's Dutch defender Sven Botman, 22, and Portugal midfielder Renato Sanches, 24, will sign for them imminently.
Liverpool's Ireland goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher, 23, will not be sold or loaned in the summer transfer window despite interest from Premier League clubs.
Manchester City are set to join Real Madrid and Manchester United in the race to sign Bayern Munich's Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, if he is available in the summer.
West Ham are increasing their efforts to sign Nottingham Forest's English defender Joe Worrall, 25, but face competition from Brentford and Everton.
Leeds United's Brazil forward Raphinha, 25, has gained interest from Barcelona and Manchester United.
Liverpool are also interested in Leeds' Raphinha.
Liverpool are closing in on the signing of Scottish 16-year-old full-back and winger Ben Doak from Celtic.
Fiorentina are in talks with Arsenal over a permanent deal for 26-year-old Uruguay midfielder Lucas Torreira, who is on loan.
Benfica are keen on Paris St-Germain's 34-year-old Argentina forward Angel di Maria.
Lazio's Albania goalkeeper Thomas Strakosha, 26, is a target for Premier League clubs.
Real Madrid's 25-year-old Spain midfielder Dani Ceballos, who spent time on loan at Arsenal between 2019 and 2021, faces an uncertain future at the Bernabeu.
Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Morocco defender Noussair Mazraoui, 24, who is out of contract with Ajax at the end of the season.
Liverpool's Egypt forward Mohamed Salah, 29, is not desperate to leave Anfield this summer and could instead depart for free next year when his contract ends.
Reds boss Jurgen Klopp will not talk to Salah and his agent amid a stand-off over a new deal for the forward.
Borussia Dortmund's Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21, will ask for a release clause to be written into any contract, should he move clubs this summer.
Manchester City are prepared to make Haaland the highest-paid player in England with a salary in excess of Â£500,000 a week.
Paris St-Germain do not intend to let Brazil forward Neymar, 30, leave this summer despite interest from his former club Barcelona.

Manchester United's links with a Â£90m move for England captain Harry Kane, 28, depend on Paris St-Germain boss Mauricio Pochettino - his former boss at Tottenham Hotspur - becoming the new Red Devils manager.
Kane says he is "motivated to get even better" under manager Antonio Conte, amid interest from Old Trafford.

Atletico Madrid's Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, 35, wants to play at least one more season in Europe before a move to the MLS, and the former Liverpool forward would consider a return to England, with Aston Villa keen.
Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign 18-year-old midfielder Toby Collyer from Brighton.
Collyer will join United on a three-and-a-half year deal.

AC Milan's 25-year-old Ivory Coast midfielder Franck Kessie will be Barcelona's first signing of the summer transfer window, with Chelsea's Denmark centre-back Andreas Christensen, 25, to follow, both on free transfers.
Manchester United have approached Borussia Dortmund over a move for 26-year-old Switzerland defender Manuel Akanji.
Fulham are interested in signing Liverpool's England defender Joe Gomez, 24, and Wales right-back Neco Williams, 20, who has impressed on loan at Craven Cottage.
Uefa has made assurances that Chelsea's last-16 second-leg tie against Lille in the Champions League will still go ahead.
Arsenal face competition from Real Madrid and Barcelona for Napoli's 25-year-old Spain midfielder Fabian Ruiz.
Arsenal will raise Â£20m towards signing a new striker from the sales of 22-year-old France midfielder Matteo Guendouzi to Marseille and 26-year-old Uruguay midfielder Lucas Torreira to Fiorentina.
The Gunners have enquired about a deal for Real Madrid's 31-year-old Belgium winger Eden Hazard.
Arsenal are set to hold talks over a new deal for 20-year-old French defender William Saliba after he impressed during his loan spell at Marseille.
Barcelona will target Wolves' Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25, as a replacement for Spain's Sergio Busquets, 33.
Barcelona are also hoping Chelsea will allow Spain defender Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, to depart Stamford Bridge for free this summer.

Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand believes the Old Trafford club should attempt to sign Paris St-Germain's Brazil centre-back Marquinhos, 27, and Barcelona's Uruguay defender Ronald Araujo, 23, to strengthen their defence.
Borussia Dortmund adviser Matthias Sammer has hinted 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland will leave the German club to join Manchester City.
Haaland has also been linked with Real Madrid but will have to reduce his salary demands if he is to move to the Spanish club.
Clubs interested in signing Haaland will have to meet the release clause in his contract - which is believed to be Â£63m - by the end of April.

Antonio Rudiger had agreed a contract extension with Chelsea but the new deal was scuppered by the turmoil of owner Roman Abramovich's sanctions by the UK government. Manchester United, Real Madrid, Paris St-Germain and Juventus are keen on the 29-year-old Germany defender, who is a free agent in the summer.
Paris St-Germain have made contact with Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte, who has a clause in his contract that allows him to leave Spurs at the end of the season.
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta is one of a number of names on PSG's list of possible replacements for manager Mauricio Pochettino, but the Spaniard says he is "extremely happy" at the Gunners.
Argentina forward Lionel Messi has no plans to leave PSG and, even though the 34-year-old has been linked with former club Barcelona, there has been no contact with the Spanish side.
Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel and Sevilla boss Julen Lopetegui are on Manchester United's managerial shortlist.
Tuchel has overtaken PSG boss Pochettino as Manchester United's number one choice and the Old Trafford club would like to appoint the German before the end of the season.
Arsenal are ready to again attempt to sign French midfielder Houssem Aouar from Lyon, having failed with a bid last summer. Juventus and Inter Milan have also been linked with the 23-year-old.
Netherlands midfielder Georginio Wijnaldum's preference will be a move back to the Premier League if the 31-year-old does not feel he is part of PSG's long-term plans.
Poland striker Robert Lewandowski's agent says there have been no discussions with Bayern Munich about extending the 33-year-old's deal.
AC Milan have begun talks to sign 26-year-old Belgium striker Divock Origi on a free transfer in the summer when his contract with Liverpool runs out.
West Ham United are interested in signing 30-year-old France striker Alexandre Lacazette, whose contract with Arsenal runs out in the summer.

Argentina winger Angel di Maria, 34, is set to leave Paris St-Germain in the summer, with the French club unlikely to trigger an option to extend his stay as they look to free up space for Barcelona's out-of-contract France winger Ousmane Dembele - although he is also wanted by Manchester United and Newcastle United.
Inter Milan directors have met the agents of 27-year-old Ajax striker Sebastien Haller, with the Dutch club's asking price for the Ivory Coast forward believed to be about 35m euros (Â£29.4m).
Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers says the Foxes have opened contract talks with 23-year-old midfielder Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall.

Barcelona have expressed interest in signing Manchester United's England forward Marcus Rashford, 24. Rashford agreed a Â£200,000-a-week United contract until June 2023 in 2019 but has struggled for form this season.
United's Portugal striker Cristiano Ronaldo, 37, is set to stay at Manchester United next season, with interim manager Ralf Rangnick likely to leave.
Arsenal are keen on signing Real Madrid's former Chelsea forward Eden Hazard, 31. The Belgium international joined Real in 2019.

Benfica have placed a Â£67m price tag on Uruguay forward Darwin Nunez, 22, who has helped his Portuguese club reach the Champions League quarter-finals. Nunez is attracting interest from Arsenal, Manchester United and Newcastle.
Nineteen-year-old Ajax and Netherlands midfielder Ryan Gravenberch could be a target for Manchester United.

Chelsea's transfer targets will be having doubts about moving to the European champions this summer, an agent has warned. The Blues have been linked with a host of players including West Ham's England midfielder Declan Rice, 23.
Jorginho's agent says that the priority is for the Italy midfielder, 30, to sign a new contract with Chelsea, despite interest from Serie A giants Juventus.
Antonio Conte will not walk away from Tottenham this summer, says captain and France goalkeeper Hugo Lloris. The 35-year-old believes the Italian is not the type to "give up in any circumstances".
Liverpool's Belgium forward Divock Origi, 26, is set to join AC Milan in the summer.

Championship leaders Fulham are lining up moves for Liverpool defenders Joe Gomez and Neco Williams. England international Gomez, 24, is rated at Â£23m by the Reds. Wales full-back Williams, 20, is currently on loan at Craven Cottage.
France midfielder Paul Pogba is ready to let his Manchester United contract expire this summer before deciding his next move, with Paris Saint-Germain keen on the 29-year-old.
Ajax boss Erik ten Hag is Manchester United's number one target to become their next manager.
Atletico Madrid are ready to pay up to Â£40m for Aston Villa's Poland full-back Matty Cash this summer.
Investment firm Aethel Partners has made keeping manager Thomas Tuchel at Chelsea its top priority after submitting a bid to buy the club. )
Paris Saint-Germain are interested in Liverpool sporting director Michael Edwards, who has already confirmed he is leaving Anfield to seek a new challenge.
Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25, will look to leave Wolves in the summer if the club does not qualify for Europe.
Newcastle, Arsenal and Manchester United are interested in Bayern Leverkusen's France winger Moussa Diaby, 21.
Real Madrid are losing hope of beating Manchester City to the signing of 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland from Borussia Dortmund.
Manchester City and Portugal midfielder Bernardo Silva, 27, says he is pining for a return to his homeland and Benfica in the next two years.
Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel has played down speculation linking him with Manchester United, saying the Stamford Bridge club "has everything it needs to make me happy".
Manchester City are expected to offer Spain midfielder Rodri a contract extension, with the 25-year-old's current deal running until 2025.

Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans, who has a contract with Leicester City until 2023, says talks are taking place with the Foxes about his future and the 24-year-old will study his options this summer.
Brazil defender Dani Alves, 38, says former Barcelona team-mate Lionel Messi is not enjoying himself at Paris St-Germain and hopes the 34-year-old Argentina forward can return to the Nou Camp.
Manchester United and Inter Milan are looking at Fiorentina and Serbia defender Nikola Milenkovic, 24.
Barcelona are interested in Tottenham and Spain defender Sergio Reguilon, 25.

Real Madrid are interested in Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni but the France international is targeting a move to the Premier League, with Liverpool, Manchester City and Manchester United interested in the 22-year-old.
Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea, 31, was left out of Spain's squad for their international friendlies against Albania and Iceland because he does not fit their style of play.
Manchester City have agreed a Â£5.4m deal to sign Atletico Mineiro forward Savio, 17, who has played for Brazil at youth level.
West Ham joined Newcastle United in monitoring 24-year-old French midfielder Ludovic Blas, who plays for Nantes.

Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba, 29, is back on Barcelona's radar after the Spanish club signed a lucrative sponsorship deal. The 29-year-old France international will be a free agent when his contact with the Old Trafford club ends in the summer.
Germany centre-back Antonio Rudiger, whose contract at Chelsea runs out in the summer, has agreed to join Juventus on a four-year contract.
Juventus are to target a move for Manchester City's Brazil striker Gabriel Jesus, 24, if the English side manage to sign Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21, from Borussia Dortmund.
Newcastle United are interested in signing 30-year-old Brazil forward Neymar, who has a deal with Paris St-Germain that runs until 2025.
Newcastle are also stepping up their interest in Everton and England defender Ben Godfrey, 24.
Barcelona coach Xavi says former team-mate Lionel Messi, 34, will "always be welcome" at the Nou Camp club. Argentina forward Messi left the La Liga side to join PSG last summer.
Messi does not intend to leave PSG and plans to see out the two-year contract he signed with the French club.
Juventus and Inter Milan are interested in Chelsea midfielder Conor Gallagher. The Englishman, 22, is currently on loan at Crystal Palace.
Chelsea defender Cesar Azpilicueta has agreed a deal in principle to join Barcelona on a free transfer and a deal for 32-year-old Spain international is expected to be completed in the summer.
The agent of Chelsea midfielder Jorginho says the 30-year-old Italy international would like to return to Serie A one day.
Manchester United are weighing up a move for Morocco and Sevilla keeper Yassine Bounou, 30.
Manchester United are interested in 24-year-old Turkey defender Merih Demiral, who is on loan at Atalanta from Juventus.
Liverpool striker Divock Origi has told the club he wants to leave in the summer. The Belgian, 26, is under contract until the end of 2024.
Atletico Madrid are the team most interested in 22-year-old Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, who has helped Benfica reach the quarter-finals of the Champions League.
Manchester United are considering a bid for Dundee United's Swiss goalkeeper Benjamin Siegrist, 30, as further cover for David de Gea.
Atletico Madrid have made an offer to 30-year-old Spain midfielder Sergi Roberto, who is set to leave Barcelona when his contract with the club runs out in the summer.
Leeds United are confident of extending English defender Luke Ayling's deal with the club, with the 30-year-old's current contract set to run out in summer 2023.
Newcastle United will let Northern Ireland defender Jamal Lewis leave in the summer, with the Tyneside club wanting about Â£8m for the 24-year-old.

Manchester City do not believe they are favourites to sign Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland and Real Madrid could try to get the 21-year-old to stay at Borussia Dortmund for one more season before trying to sign him.
Former Real Madrid midfielder Guti says the club will be unable to sign Haaland if they fail to capture him this summer.

Aston Villa cold face competition to sign Brazil playmaker Philippe Coutinho from Barcelona on a permanent basis in the summer, with Arsenal reportedly planning a move for the 29-year-old after seeing him flourish in the Premier League while on loan with Villa.
Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, is unhappy at Chelsea and will look to leave the club in the summer, less than a year after the European champions re-signed him for a club-record Â£97.5m.

Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti wants to sign 25-year-old Inter Milan midfielder Nicolo Barella and the Italy international's arrival could put a doubt over the future of German Toni Kroos, 32, at the Bernabeu club.
France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni is attracting interest from Chelsea, Liverpool, Paris St-Germain and Real Madrid but Monaco will not accept less than 50m euros (Â£42m) for the 22-year-old.
Aston Villa are leading the race to sign Leeds United midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, and are prepared to pay Â£60m for the England international.
Juventus manager Massimiliano Allegri says he does not know if Argentine forward Paulo Dybala will be at the club next season, with the 28-year-old's contract running out in the summer.

Former Barcelona coach Ronald Koeman is in talks about returning to his role as manager of the Dutch national team and succeeding current Netherlands boss Louis van Gaal, whose contract runs out after the 2022 World Cup.
Roma and Hellas Verona are interested in 25-year-old Chelsea playmaker Charly Musonda, with the Belgian set to leave the Stamford Bridge club in the summer.
Manchester United are monitoring 30-year-old Swiss goalkeeper Benjamin Siegrist, who plays for Dundee United and is out of contract in the summer.
Chelsea right-back Reece James, 22, is set to pull out of the England squad and Crystal Palace defender Tyrick Mitchell, 22, will be called up as a replacement.

Manchester United want Everton and Brazil forward Richarlison. The 24-year-old has also been linked with Real Madrid, managed by former Toffees boss Carlo Ancelotti.
Juventus have confirmed Paulo Dybala will leave the club as a free agent in the summer. The Argentine forward, 28, has previously been sought by Manchester United and Tottenham.

Newcastle will go back in for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen, despite the Italian side reportedly turning down a Â£100m bid by the Magpies for the 23-year-old Nigeria international in the January window.

Mauricio Pochettino, Erik ten Hag, Julen Lopetegui and Luis Enrique are on the four-man shortlist being considered by Manchester United in their search for a permanent manager to replace Ralf Rangnick in the summer.
Ajax boss Ten Hag is the frontrunner for the job at Old Trafford after the Red Devils complied extensive background checks on each of the candidates.
Arsenal will make a move for Arthur Melo, 25, from Juventus in the summer after failing to agree a deal for the Brazil midfielder in January.
Inter Milan have identified Manchester United and Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, 35, as a replacement for Chile forward Alexis Sanchez, 33.
Arsenal and Liverpool are monitoring PSV Eindhoven's highly-rated Cody Gakpo, 22, but will face competition for the Netherlands winger from Barcelona and Bayern Munich.
Manchester City are preparing a bid for Boavista's 21-year-old Ecuadorian central defender Jackson Porozo.
Leeds United are interested in Trabzonspor captain and Turkey goalkeeper Ugurcan Cakir, 25, and will watch him in Thursday's World Cup qualifier play-off against Portugal.
Arsenal are keen to tie Bukayo Saka down to another long-term contract to fend off interest from Premier League rivals in the 20-year-old England attacking midfielder.
Leicester have joined the list of clubs interested in buying 20-year-old Salzburg and Austria forward Chukwubuike Adamu.

Derby County full-back Festy Ebosele looks set to join Udinese in the summer when he becomes a free agent, with reports the Irish 19-year-old has signed a pre-contract agreement with the Serie A club.
Celtic goalkeeper Vasilis Barkas has told the club he wants to leave Parkhead in the summer after the Greece international, 27, slipped down the order to be third-choice keeper.
Newcastle retain a long-held interest in England goalkeeper Dean Henderson, 25, and will wait on Manchester United's decision on a loan move this summer. His Old Trafford contract runs to 2025.
Magpies boss Eddie Howe is also set to raid his former club Bournemouth with a Â£12m move for English defender Lloyd Kelly, 23.
The UK and Ireland are set to be named as joint hosts of Euro 2028 with no rival bid having come forward before Wednesday's deadline.
AC Milan are preparing a contract offer for Belgium striker Divock Origi after the 26-year-old told Liverpool that he will leave the club when his current deal expires this summer.
Premier League referee Mike Dean will quit on-field officiating at the end of the season and take up a full-time role as a Video Assistant Referee.
Juventus are preparing a huge financial package to lure 29-year-old Egypt forward Mohamed Salah from Liverpool to Turin.
Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, 28, is set to leave Juventus on a free transfer after the club opted against renewing his contract.
West Ham United will demand a British record transfer fee of Â£150m for England midfielder Declan Rice, 23, this summer.
Leeds United are preparing to offer Kalvin Phillips a new contract in an attempt to stave off interest from West Ham and Aston Villa in the England midfielder, 26.
Ivory Coast midfielder Franck Kessie, 25, has agreed a four-year contract with Barcelona and will join the Nou Camp club in the summer when his deal with AC Milan runs out.
Germany centre-back Antonio Rudiger, 29, is demanding a Â£25m signing-on fee as he prepares to leave Chelsea as a free agent.
Tottenham can turn Dejan Kulusevski's loan move from Juventus into a permanent transfer this summer by paying 30m euros (Â£24.9m) for the Sweden winger, 21.
Belgium winger Eden Hazard is confused and frustrated at Real Madrid, who intend to offload the 31-year-old this summer.
Serbia striker Luka Jovic, 24, is not part of Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti's plans and will also leave the Spanish club in the summer.
There are doubts over the future of Lazio's Italian manager Maurizio Sarri after they lost the derby against Roma 3-0 on Sunday.
Newcastle United are stepping up their bid to sign Bournemouth's 23-year-old English centre-back Lloyd Kelly in a Â£12m deal.
Brazil forward Raphinha, 25, has rejected Leeds United's first approach over a new contract.
Former Manchester United and Netherlands striker Ruud van Nistelrooy, 45, is the frontrunner for the PSV Eindhoven manager's job.
Arsenal and Tottenham are tracking Galatasaray's 23-year-old Turkish winger Muhammed Kerem Akturkoglu.
Brazil star Neymar, 30, earns Â£600,000 per month more than Argentina's Lionel Messi, 34, at Paris St-Germain.
Brentford and Burnley have already had bids rejected for Joe Worrall and now West Ham and Everton have joined the list of admirers of Nottingham Forest's English centre-back, 25.
Tottenham striker Harry Kane, 28, refused to commit himself to Spurs after being asked about his future while on England duty.

England midfielder Declan Rice would prefer to move to Chelsea rather than Manchester United if he were to leave West Ham, who have put a Â£150m asking price on the the 23-year-old to fend off interest in him.
Roma are set to place a Â£100m price tag on Tammy Abraham, 24, with the England forward attracting Premier League interest during a prolific first season in Italy.

Juventus, Real Madrid and Paris St-Germain are favourites to sign Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba, 29, who is available on a free transfer in the summer. Newcastle and Aston Villa are also monitoring the situation.
Newcastle United will not be making a move for Paris St-Germain's Brazil forward Neymar, 30, and are set to have a summer transfer budget of less than the Â£90m they spent in January.
The Magpies plan to sell Paraguay midfielder Miguel Almiron in the summer and will allow the 28-year-old to leave for Â£15m.
Arsenal are looking at Benfica striker Darwin Nunez and have held background talks with the 22-year-old's Uruguay international's agent.
West Ham are monitoring Dutch defender Sven Botman but will face competition from Newcastle United and AC Milan if they want to sign the 22-year-old from Lille.
Tottenham, PSG and Real Madrid were interested in Ivory Coast midfielder Franck Kessie, but the 25-year-old will join Barcelona when his contract runs out with AC Milan in the summer.
Spain defender Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, has knocked back questions about his future amid talk he will leave Chelsea to join Barcelona in the summer.
France defender William Saliba, who is on loan at Marseille from Arsenal, says his future depends on talks with the Gunners. The 20-year-old has a contract until 2024 with the London club.
Barcelona do not intend to increase their offer to Uruguayan defender Ronald Araujo, with the 23-year-old's deal with them coming to an end in 2023.
Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich has reportedly opened talks to try to buy Turkish Super Lig club Goztepe as the process of selling the Blues continues following his sanctioning by the UK government.
Leeds United are ready to offer Anderlecht's Sergio Gomez a deal, with the Spanish 21-year-old left-back having caught the eye of the Whites' sporting director Victor Orta. ()
Liverpool are poised to sign Irish 15-year-old Derry winger Trent Kone Doherty. ()
Barcelona have joined Liverpool, Manchester City and Bayern Munich in the race to sign Leeds' Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, valued at Â£60m by his club.
Real Madrid face competition from La Liga rivals Barcelona for the signature of Paris St-Germain and France forward Kylian Mbappe, 23.
Barcelona are also interested in Bayern Munich striker and Poland captain Robert Lewandowski, 33.
Liverpool striker Divock Origi, 26, is in talks with Serie A rivals AC Milan and Inter Milan over a potential free transfer in the summer.
Manchester City are among a number of Premier League clubs monitoring Crystal Palace left-back Tyrick Mitchell, the 22-year-old recently called up to the England squad for the first time.
Paris St-Germain, Real Madrid, Barcelona and Chelsea are monitoring Manchester City's Algeria winger Riyad Mahrez, 31.
Roma would not sell English striker Tammy Abraham, 24, for less than Â£100m this summer, with Manchester United and Arsenal both believed to be interested.
West Ham's England midfielder Declan Rice would still prefer a move to Chelsea rather than Manchester United.
Chelsea defender Marcos Alonso, 31, says he would "love" to play in La Liga again. The Spaniard made just one league appearance for Real Madrid after coming through their youth system.
Chelsea captain Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, is torn between signing a new one-year contract with the Blues or accepting a one-year offer from Barcelona.
Germany international Antonio Rudiger, 29, could be the third Chelsea defender to leave Stamford Bridge as he is out of contract in the summer and has been offered a deal by Juventus.
Arsenal, Manchester United and Newcastle are all interested in signing 22-year-old French winger Moussa Diaby from Bayer Leverkusen.
Blackburn and Chile striker Ben Brereton Diaz, 22, is attracting interest from Sevilla to fill the La Liga side's number nine role.
West Ham could make another move for Benfica and Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, after having a club-record Â£50m bid for the 22-year-old rejected in January.
Leeds are interested in signing English winger Ryan Kent from Rangers, with the 25-year-old having a Â£20m release clause.
Arsenal and Tottenham will need to pay Â£20m to sign 21-year-old Middlesbrough full-back Djed Spence, who is impressing on loan at Nottingham Forest.
Benfica and Sporting Lisbon are considering a move for Barcelona winger Francisco Trincao, should the on-loan 22-year-old not join Wolves permanently for Â£25m.
Barcelona's Spanish midfield sensation Gavi, 17, and Uruguay defender Ronald Araujo have rejected new contract offers from the club.

Barcelona manager Xavi is determined to bring Liverpool and Egypt striker Mohamed Salah, 29, to the Nou Camp as the cash-strapped Catalan giants look set to miss out on main target Erling Braut Haaland. ()
Barcelona president Joan Laporta says he won't put the club at financial risk to sign 21-year-old Norway striker Haaland from Borussia Dortmund. ()
The Catalan club also have an eye on Bayern Munich and Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33.
Liverpool's hopes of signing Spain midfielder Gavi have been boosted by the 17-year-old turning down a third offer of a new deal at Barcelona.
Leeds United have rejected a Â£29m offer from Barcelona for Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, whose buyout clause is set at Â£60m. ()
Wolves and Portugal winger Pedro Neto is on Paris St-Germain's wanted list as the 22-year-old makes his comeback from a long-term injury. ()
Newcastle United are preparing to fight AC Milan to sign 22-year-old Netherlands central defender Sven Botman from Lille, after failing to land him in January. ()
The Magpies are also looking to strengthen up front by bringing in Benfica and Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, 22, despite strong interest from Arsenal. ()
Arsenal are in negotiations to bring Brazil manager Tite, 60, to the club when he steps down from his post after the Qatar World Cup.
Manchester United are keen on Switzerland defender Manuel Akanji, 26, who has refused new contract offers from Borussia Dortmund and is valued at about Â£25m by the Bundesliga club. ()
Liverpool, Manchester City and Manchester United are battling to sign Rangers' 16-year-old Scottish striker Rory Wilson. ()

Liverpool will not join the race to sign West Ham United and England midfielder Declan Rice this summer despite manager Jurgen Klopp being a huge admirer of the 23-year-old, who is a target for Manchester United, Manchester City and Chelsea.

Marcelo Bielsa has been contacted about returning to management less than a month after being sacked by Leeds United.

Ismaila Sarr could leave Watford for Liverpool in the summer with the Reds reigniting their interest in the 24-year-old Senegal winger, but they face competition from AC Milan. ()

Real Madrid's Eden Hazard will have surgery this week, keeping him out of action for a month and complicating a mooted return to Chelsea for the 31-year-old Belgium playmaker. ()
Charlton defender Lucas Ness, 22, is being tracked by multiple clubs including Norwich City, Burnley, Coventry City and Plymouth Argyle. ()
Arsenal are preparing an offer for Manchester United's 24-year-old England forward Marcus Rashford.

Ajax manager Erik ten Hag is surprised Manchester United have not offered him a contract to become manager after telling the club money will not be an issue in luring him to Old Trafford.

Leicester City's Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans, 24, says he wants to play Champions League football.
Manchester United and Arsenal have both been linked with Tielemans, who could be allowed to leave Leicester for Â£35m at the end of the season.
Southampton and Crystal Palace are interested in signing English midfielder Harry Winks, 26, from Tottenham.
Argentina forward Paulo Dybala could move from Juventus to Serie A rivals Inter Milan, with Inter lining up the 28-year-old as a replacement for fellow Argentine Lautaro Martinez, 24.

West Ham are keen on loan moves for Ukraine-based forwards David Neres and Lassina Traore. Neres, 25, and Traore, 21, play for Shakhtar Donetsk and could move during a special loan window set up for players in the country but Shakhtar feel offers from other clubs may be more appealing.

Napoli would want 100m euros (Â£83m) for 23-year-old Nigeria forward Victor Osimhen, who has received interest from several clubs including Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester United, Newcastle and Tottenham.

Barcelona could offer 22-year-old Spanish central defender Oscar Mingueza as part of any deal to sign Raphinha from Leeds.

Ligue 1 side PSG could also move to sign Chelsea's Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, in the summer.

Barcelona have reached agreement with Brazil forward Raphinha, 25, over a move from Leeds United this summer.

Barcelona are set to release seven players this summer as they look to reinforce, with Chelsea's Spanish defender Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, and Danish centre-back Andreas Christensen, 25, both linked with moves to the Nou Camp.
Tottenham are leading the race to sign Netherlands forward Memphis Depay, 28, from Barcelona.
West Ham midfielder Declan Rice, 23, is in the frame as a future England captain, according to Three Lions boss Gareth Southgate.
Real Madrid are preparing a Â£50m bid for Arsenal and Scotland defender Kieran Tierney, 24.

Chelsea have been boosted in their pursuit of Aurelien Tchouameni after the agent of the 22-year-old Monaco and France midfielder denied they have an agreement with Real Madrid.
Barcelona and Spain midfielder Pedri, 19, says he wants Lionel Messi to rejoin Barcelona after the 34-year-old Argentine's difficult first season at Paris St-Germain. (lexternal-link)
Derby County boss Wayne Rooney, 36, says he rejected a move to Manchester United when he was 14 because he wanted to play for Everton. ()
Barcelona's Brazilian playmaker Philippe Coutinho, 29, is willing to take a pay-cut to make his loan move to Aston Villa permanent. ()
Prospective Chelsea owners have been given a deadline of 11 April to submit final bids for the club.
Napoli have set a price tag of Â£83m for their 23-year-old Nigerian striker Victor Osimhen.

Barcelona's attempt to sign Liverpool's Egypt forward Mohamed Salah, 29, is set to be thwarted by their inability to comply with La Liga's financial rules.
Liverpool will face competition from Real Madrid for Borussia Dortmund's England midfielder Jude Bellingham, 18.
Leeds United have placed a Â£67m (80m euros) price tag on Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, with Barcelona only willing to pay about half that figure.

Manchester United, Liverpool and Newcastle are interested in signing Portugal midfielder Otavio, 27, from Porto this summer.
Arsenal and Atletico Madrid are vying for the signature of Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez, 24, who Inter Milan will sell if they receive an offer of Â£58m this summer.

Striker Paulo Dybala wants to join Atletico Madrid this summer when his Juventus contract expires - and although Inter Milan are also interested in the 28-year-old, they can only afford him if they sell fellow Argentine Martinez.

Liverpool have reached an agreement in principle to sign former England Under-18 international Fabio Carvalho from Fulham, after almost sealing a deal for the attacking midfielder, 19, during the January transfer window.

Ivory Coast winger Nicolas Pepe, 26, has hinted at a summer exit from Arsenal, three years after his club-record Â£72m move from Lille.

Leicester City have been linked with Club Bruges forward Charles de Ketelaere. The 21-year-old has scored 17 goals in 41 games this season and won his fifth Belgium cap in last weekend's friendly against the Republic of Ireland.

Newcastle United are targeting Watford winger Ismaila Sarr, 24, with Liverpool also watching the Senegal international.

Manchester United are ready to open contract talks with England striker Marcus Rashford, 24, and England left-back Luke Shaw, 26.
But United have no intention to discuss extensions for England midfielder Jesse Lingard, 29, Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, 35, and former Spain midfielder Juan Mata, 33.
Napoli are hopeful of preventing Senegal centre-back Kalidou Koulibaly from leaving on a free transfer by offering the 30-year-old a new long-term contract.
Barcelona are set to rival Real Madrid in a bid to sign Arsenal and Scotland full-back Kieran Tierney, 24.
Arsenal are leading the chase to sign Netherlands winger Cody Gakpo, 22, from PSV Eindhoven.

Barcelona have prioritised the signing of Chelsea and Spain defender Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, this summer.
Germany forward Timo Werner wants to leave Chelsea and the Blues will not stand in the 26-year-old's way - as long as their price tag of 40m euros (Â£33m) is met.
If Erik ten Hag takes over as Manchester United manager, he is keen on signing Brazil winger Antony, 22, from his current club Ajax.
Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba, 29, will need to take a significant pay cut if he wants to rejoin Juventus this summer.
Benfica striker Darwin Nunez, 22, who is a target for Tottenham, will only be allowed to leave for a deal worth over 80m euros (Â£67m) this summer.

Real Madrid have identified Borussia Dortmund and England midfielder Jude Bellingham as a target, despite strong links between the 18-year-old and a move to Liverpool.

Barcelona have not yet made an offer for Leeds forward Raphinha, but personal terms have been discussed with the 25-year-old's agent. The Brazilian winger only has a clause in his contract to determine his price if his club are relegated.
Chelsea will join the race to sign Argentina striker Paulo Dybala, 28, on a free transfer from Juventus once the club's takeover is complete.

Arsenal are ready to let 26-year-old Uruguayan midfielder Lucas Torreira - currently on loan at Fiorentina - leave permanently in the summer, while 29-year-old Egyptian midfielder Mohamed Elneny is also set to depart.

Brighton are the latest English club to show interest in 16-year-old Scottish striker Rory Wilson, who has scored 40 goals for Rangers' youth sides this season - and has been linked heavily with Aston Villa.
The Seagulls have also made a Â£250,000 bid for Kilmarnock's 16-year-old Scotland U17 defender Charlie McArthur, who is interesting Wolves and West Ham.

Barcelona have opened talks with Ousmane Dembele, 24, over a new contract. The France forward has been linked with a free transfer move to Paris St-Germain or Chelsea when his current deal expires this summer.

Everton will have to sell one of their star forwards, England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 25, or 24-year-old Brazil international Richarlison, in the summer after posting losses of Â£121m last season.

Ten Hag could play a key role in signing PSV Eindhoven's 22-year-old Dutch forward Cody Gakpo for Manchester United, should the Ajax manager be appointed as the next Old Trafford boss.

Barcelona have made a bid to take advantage of the sanctions placed on Chelsea by trying to sign three of the club's Champions League-winning defenders - Germany's Antonio Rudiger, 29, Spain's Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, and Denmark's Andreas Christensen, 25.

Leeds United are looking at signing Barcelona and United States full-back Sergino Dest, 21.

Middlesbrough right wing-back Djed Spence, on loan at Nottingham Forest, wants a Premier League move - as Arsenal and Tottenham line up a Â£20m summer bid, and Manchester United also interested in the 21-year-old England Under-21 international.

Arsenal have been undertaking extensive scouting of Napoli and Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen, 23, and Inter Milan and Argentina forward Lautaro Martinez, 24.
Aston Villa are preparing to break their transfer record again this summer and are likely to spend more than Â£150m on new signings.
Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel is "confident" the club will be able to sort out a new contract for Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, 29.
Tottenham, who made an enquiry for Leeds United winger Jack Harrison in January, are interested in signing the 25-year-old Englishman during the summer.

Newcastle United are willing to sell French forward Allan Saint-Maximin, 25, for about Â£50m this summer and Aston Villa are one of the clubs monitoring the situation.

Bayern Munich's Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, has told Barcelona he wants to join them this summer if they can offer him a contract of more than two years.

Erik ten Hag has already lined up his first two signings if he becomes Manchester United manager, both from his current club Ajax - Brazil winger Antony, 22, and Netherlands centre-half Jurrien Timber, 20.

Barcelona hope to agree a contract extension with Ronald Araujo next week as they are aware the Uruguay centre-back, 23, has received offers from Premier League clubs.

Liverpool want to sign a top-class central midfielder this summer - and their number one target is West Ham's England international Declan Rice, 23.

Manchester City's pursuit of Borussia Dortmund's Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21, is set to land England midfielder Phil Foden, 21, an even bigger pay rise at City.

Aston Villa will push for a Â£60m move for Leeds United's England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, this summer.

Barcelona want to agree a contract extension for Ronald Araujo, who has received an offer from Manchester United, but the Uruguay centre-back, 23, has not taken kindly to Barca's pursuit of Rudiger and Chelsea's Denmark 25-year-old defender Andreas Christensen.
Wales forward Gareth Bale, 32, is among a number of Real Madrid players who will be offloaded this summer.
Arsenal and Tottenham are interested in Lautaro Martinez but Inter Milan will only sell the Argentina striker, 24, if they receive a bid of more than 80m euros (Â£67.3m).

Aston Villa will attempt to secure a permanent transfer for Anwar El Ghazi this summer, but Everton have no plans to sign the Netherlands winger, 26, when his loan spell expires.

Birmingham City are bracing themselves for interest from Premier League and European clubs in their England Under-18 midfielder George Hall, 17.
Newcastle are lining up a Â£20m offer to Brighton for Spain goalkeeper Robert Sanchez, 24, in the summer and also targeting Watford's Senegal winger Ismaila Sarr, 24.
Everton will let Allan leave in the summer, despite the Brazil midfielder, 31, having another year left on his contract.
Former Armenia midfielder Henrikh Mkhitaryan is out of contract in the summer, but, after an upturn in form, Roma are set to open talks over a new deal for the 33-year-old this week.
Christian Eriksen's former club Tottenham and Manchester United are considering signing the Denmark midfielder, 30, on a free transfer this summer after seeing his return to top form at Brentford.
Barcelona's Uruguay defender Ronald Araujo, 23, is set to ignore more lucrative offers from Manchester United and Liverpool to renew his contract.
Newcastle are interested in signing Chelsea's Kepa Arrizabalaga, 27, or Spanish compatriot Robert Sanchez, 24, who is at Brighton, to strengthen their goalkeeping options this summer.
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he is "happy" with how contract talks are developing with Egypt forward Mohamed Salah, 29.
There remains optimismthat Liverpool could sign France forward Kylian Mbappe, 23, from Paris St-Germain this summer - should Mohamed Salah decide to leave.
Kylian Mbappe says remaining at PSG is also still an option, despite his contract expiring this summer.
An unnamed club has joined Real Madrid in competing for France striker Kylian Mbappe's signature.
Roma's England striker Tammy Abraham, 24, has hinted at a possible return to the Premier League.

Germany winger Serge Gnabry, 26, is considering leaving Bayern Munich this summer amid interest from Real Madrid and Liverpool.
