FC Cologne's Timo Hubers is a Â£6m target for Newcastle, Leeds and Crystal Palace this summer, while West Ham, Southampton and Fulham are also monitoring the German centre-back, 25.
Newcastle have been told Â£25m will be enough to tempt Union Berlin into selling Nigeria striker Taiwo Awoniyi this summer, although West Ham and Southampton are also interested in the 24-year-old.

Wolves' Ruben Neves, 25, is attracting interest from Barcelona, while fellow Portugal midfielder Joao Moutinho, 35, could also leave Molineux in the summer, with the club eyeing Sporting Lisbon's Portugal midfielders Matheus Nunes, 23, and Joao Palhinha, 26, as potential replacements.

Manchester United could again look at signing Lazio's Serbia midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, 27, to replace France midfielder Paul Pogba, 29.
The Manchester United dressing room is split over the possible appointment of Ajax's Erik ten Hag as manager.

Tottenham have opened talks over a new contract with 18-year-old English striker Dane Scarlett.
Brazilian club Botafogo have agreed to sign QPR's Finland left-back Niko Hamalainen, 25, initially on loan.
Paris St-Germain have made an offer to France midfielder Paul Pogba, 29, as he enters the final months of his Manchester United contract - but the Ligue 1 club have offered less money than United.
Real Madrid remain confident of signing 23-year-old France forward Kylian Mbappe from PSG this summer, despite reports suggesting he is close to agreeing a new deal to stay in Paris.
Tottenham Hotspur's England striker Harry Kane, 28, would be curious to listen to any offer from Manchester United this summer before making a decision on his long-term future.
Barcelona want to sign Bayern Munich and Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, who wants a three-year deal.
Crystal Palace will listen to offers for Ivory Coast forward Wilfried Zaha, 29.
Wales forward Gareth Bale, 32, will leave Real Madrid at the end of the season, but no decision has been made on where his future lies, his agent has said.
Manchester United and Atletico Madrid are among several teams considering a move for Benfica's 22-year-old Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez.

Liverpool are closing in on three new signings. The Reds have reached agreements for Fulham's Portuguese midfielder Fabio Carvalho, 19, Celtic's Scottish winger Ben Doak, 16, and Derry City's 15-year-old Irish winger Trent Kone-Doherty.
Manchester City are hopeful of agreeing a new contract with 21-year-old England midfielder Phil Foden before the end of the season.
Barcelona have met France winger Ousmane Dembele's agent in an attempt to start negotiations with the 24-year-old, who cost Â£135m in 2017, out of contract in the summer.
The potential appointment of Erik ten Hag as Manchester United manager could see 20-year-old Dutch defender Jurrien Timber and 22-year-old Brazilian winger Antony follow from Ajax this summer.
United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick could use his RB Leipzig contacts to bring Austria midfielder Konrad Laimer, 24, to Old Trafford.
Manchester United's search for a new manager is at an advanced stage, with the final decision between Ajax coach Ten Hag and PSG's Mauricio Pochettino imminent.
Dutchman Ten Hag is in active communication with United and has received information from the club, including about the club's transfer budget and potential signings.
Former England manager and United assistant manager Steve McClaren is under consideration to become Ten Hag's number two, should the Dutchman be appointed at Old Trafford.
Real Madrid are leading the race to sign Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni, with Manchester City also interested in the Â£67m-rated 22-year-old France player.
Newcastle United are open to selling French forward Allan Saint-Maximin, 25, in the summer.
Argentina striker Gonzalo Higuain, 34, who plays for Inter Miami - the Major League Soccer side part-owned by David Beckham - will retire at the end of the current season, according to his father.

Despite interest from Manchester United and Liverpool, Uruguay defender Ronald Araujo, 23, is close to agreeing a new long-term deal with Barcelona, his agent has confirmed.
Tottenham are expected to trigger their option to sign Sweden winger Dejan Kulusevski, 21, from Juventus at the first opportunity this summer.
Spurs can exercise a clause to sign Kulusevski permanently for Â£25m, rather than wait until his loan expires, when the option could cost Â£33.5m.
Chelsea's 23-year-old United States winger Christian Pulisic has dismissed speculation linking him with a move away from Stamford Bridge.
Arsenal will try to sell Iceland goalkeeper Alex Runarsson, 27, in the summer when he returns to the club after a loan spell at Belgian side Leuven.

Dutchman Ten Hag also wants to bring 20-year-old Ajax and Netherlands defender Jurrien Timber with him to Old Trafford.
The Austrian FA has denied meeting current Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick over the managerial vacancy with their men's national team.

Manchester United's Paul Pogba, 29, favours a return to Juventus over a move to Paris St-Germain when his deal expires this summer, but the Italian side have doubts over the transfer because of the France midfielder's wage demands and age.
Liverpool view Villarreal's Netherlands winger Arnaut Danjuma, 25, as a potential replacement for 29-year-old Senegal forward Sadio Mane, but the Reds are not expected to make a bid until 2023.
Brighton have no plans to sell goalkeeper Robert Sanchez amid interest from Newcastle in the 24-year-old Spain international.
The agent of Chelsea and Germany forward Timo Werner, 26, has been in Italy meeting with AC Milan, Juventus and Atalanta.
Arsenal, Everton and Newcastle have all expressed interest in signing 28-year-old Netherlands forward Memphis Depay from Barcelona.
PSV Eindhoven and Netherlands winger Cody Gakpo, 22, has revealed his fondness for Arsenal as he continues to be linked with a host of Premier League clubs, including Manchester United and Liverpool.
Senior figures at Inter Milan are now more open to 28-year-old Chelsea and Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku returning to the club.
Former Brighton technical director Dan Ashworth is being prevented from taking up his new post as sporting director at Newcastle, with the Seagulls demanding Â£5m to release him from gardening leave.

Manchester United are prepared to break their transfer record to sign West Ham and England midfielder Declan Rice, 23.
Manchester United are working on a deal to sign Leeds United and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26.
The Old Trafford club have told six players they can leave this summer.
Paris St-Germain have offered 23-year-old France striker Kylian Mbappe, whose contract with them runs out in the summer, 150m euros (Â£125m) for two seasons to stay with them.
Manchester United sent scouts to watch Villarreal winger Arnaut Danjuma against Bayern Munich on Wednesday, with the 25-year-old Dutch international also a target for Liverpool.

Everton boss Frank Lampard has the support of club owner Farhad Moshiri and the Goodison Park club's board, despite the Toffees precariously sitting just one point above the Premier League relegation zone.
Newcastle and West Ham are keen to sign Union Berlin and Nigeria striker Taiwo Awoniyi, 24, this summer.
Arsenal, Manchester United and Tottenham have been told it will cost them Â£67m if they want to sign Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, 22, from Portuguese club Benfica.

Aston Villa have shown renewed interest in Brighton and Mali midfielder Yves Bissouma, 25.
Spurs are keen to agree a deal to take Brentford and Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen, 30, back to the club.

Newcastle have shown an interest in Juventus and Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, 28.
Fulham and Portugal Under-21 forward Fabio Carvalho, 19, has agreed a move to Liverpool.

Barcelona and Wolves could agree a swap deal that would see 26-year-old winger Adama Traore make his loan with the Spanish club permanent, allowing on-loan Barca winger Francisco Trincao, 22, to do the same at Wolves.

Liverpool's Egypt forward Mohamed Salah says it is not the right time to talk about his ongoing contract talks with the club, which the 29-year-old has described as a "sensitive situation".

Benfica striker Darwin Nunez, 22, has confirmed he is changing agents before the summer transfer window, with Premier League sides Arsenal and Manchester United said to be possible destinations for the Uruguay international.

The Gunners have also held meetings with Real Madrid over the possible loan signing of Belgium forward Eden Hazard, 31.
Newcastle are ready to make a move for Leeds midfielder Kalvin Phillips. The 26-year-old England international has also been linked with Manchester United.

Everton's hierarchy do not believe sacking manager Frank Lampard will improve their prospects of avoiding relegation from the Premier League at this stage.

With France forward Kylian Mbappe, 23, expected to remain at Paris Saint-Germain, Real Madrid are preparing to step up their pursuit of Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Braut Haaland - dealing a blow to Manchester City's chances of signing the Norwegian, 21.

Tottenham manager Antonio Conte will hold a meeting with former Manchester United and Manchester City striker Carlos Tevez next week, over a possible deal for the 38-year-old Argentine free agent.

Derby County's prospective new owner wants manager Wayne Rooney to remain in charge of the relegation-threatened Championship club.

If Nunez leaves, Benfica boss Nelson Verissimo hopes the club will receive close to the Â£113m they received for Joao Felix from Atletico Madrid in 2019.
Borussia Dortmund's Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21, has dismissed interest from Manchester United because he does not believe they can fulfil his ambitions.
Haaland has not decided between Manchester City and Real Madrid, although it is unlikely he will move to Barcelona.

Chelsea have approached Arsenal's English academy forward Khayon Edwards over a potential summer transfer, with the 18-year-old yet to agree a professional deal with the Gunners.
A number of Premier League and European clubs are expected to make a summer move for Chelsea's 19-year-old English defender Levi Colwill, who has impressed on loan at Huddersfield this season.
Spain forward Marco Asensio is expected to leave Real Madrid this summer with AC Milan and Tottenham interested in the 26-year-old.
Paris St-Germain have made Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba, 29, a priority signing.
Wolves and Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25, is a target for Arsenal.
Poland striker Robert Lewandowski plans to leave Bayern Munich in the summer and has agreed terms on a move to Barcelona. The 33-year-old's deal with Bayern runs out in summer 2023.

Lewandowski could leave Bayern Munich in the summer but talk about an agreement with Barcelona is premature and he is set to hold initial talks over a new deal with his current club in the coming weeks.
Manchester City are ready to trigger Real Sociedad's Â£50m (60m euros) release clause for Spain and former Newcastle United midfielder Mikel Merino, 25.

Pep Guardiola is also keen on adding River Plate midfielder Enzo Fernandez to his squad, having monitored the 21-year-old Argentine after Manchester City signed his team-mate and compatriot Julian Alvarez, 22, in January.

Tottenham boss Antonio Conte wants to make Sweden midfielder Dejan Kulusevski's loan deal from Juventus permanent. The 21-year-old would cost Spurs Â£29m (35m euros) on top of the 10m euros they have already paid for the 18-month loan.

Besiktas left-back Ridvan Yilmaz, 20, could link up with Turkey international team-mate Caglar Soyuncu at Leicester, with the Foxes preparing an Â£8.3m (10m euros) bid to beat off competition from Torino and Stuttgart.
NBA chairman Larry Tanenbaum and Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin have joined a consortium headed by Boston Celtics co-owner Stephen Pagliuca bidding to buy Chelsea.
Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, 22, will leave Benfica in the summer for 80m euros (Â£67m).
Despite their strong interest in Nunez, Arsenal have slipped down the pecking order for his signature, behind Manchester United, Chelsea and PSG.
Liverpool and Belgium striker Divock Origi, 26, has agreed a deal with AC Milan to join the Italian club on a free transfer in the summer.

Aston Villa's English striker Danny Ings, 29, could be offered to Brighton in a swap deal for 25-year-old Mali international midfielder Yves Bissouma, as Steven Gerrard plans further clear-outs and a rebuilt squad at Villa Park.

Chelsea's Romelu Lukaku could end up back at the San Siro as former Inter Milan president Massimo Moratti says the Serie A club have a difficult decision to make between signing the 28-year-old Belgium striker and Juventus and Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, 28.
Manchester United are lining up their former striker Robin van Persie as a coaching assistant to incoming manager Erik ten Hag.

United and Tottenham are both interested in the summer signing of West Brom and England's 29-year-old goalkeeper Sam Johnstone.

Brentford are hopeful Denmark playmaker Christian Eriksen will remain at the club beyond the end of his six-month deal, but the Bees face "fierce competition" for the 30-year-old's signature from his former side Tottenham.

Spanish defender Pablo Mari, 28, has revealed his intention to stay in Italy after his loan spell at Udinese from Arsenal ends in the summer.

Manchester City's Republic of Ireland goalkeeper Gavin Bazunu is attracting interest from a number of clubs in the Premier League and across Europe. The 20-year-old will hold talks with City regarding his future when his loan spell at Portsmouth ends.

Paulo Dybala's representatives are in talks with Inter Milan over a free transfer move from Serie A rivals Juventus, with the 28-year-old Argentina playmaker's deal set to expire at the end of the season.

Newcastle want to make Brentford's Christian Eriksen their 'flagship' summer signing and will compete with Tottenham, Everton and West Ham for the 30-year-old Denmark midfielder, while the Bees are keen to extend his contract in west London.

Fernandez has already held talks with Manchester United and Real Madrid and currently has a release clause of 20m euros (Â£16.6m).

West Ham and Wolves will have to pay Sevilla 70m euros (Â£58.1m) to trigger the release clause of Argentina winger Lucas Ocampos, 27, with the Spanish side eager to extend his contract by one year and increase the release fee to 90m euros (Â£74.7m).
Arsenal are preparing a 20m euro (Â£16.6m) offer for Galatasaray's 23-year-old Turkey winger Kerem Akturkoglu.

England striker Harry Kane, 28, is set to turn down a move to Manchester United this summer and stay at Tottenham, with the Old Trafford outfit set to announce Erik ten Hag as their new manager rather than Kane's former Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino.

Sevilla's Brazilian centre-back Diego Carlos, 29, could be a viable option for Newcastle United this summer if another January target, Dutch centre-back Sven Botman, 22, chooses to leave Lille for AC Milan.

Real Madrid are also interested in Tchouameni and are in talks to sign him, with Monaco valuing the player at more than Â£50m.
Croatia midfielder Luka Modric, 36, has two offers - one from Juventus and the other from Qatar - if he decides to leave Real Madrid when his contract runs out in the summer.
Borussia Dortmund have broken through in their pursuit of Red Bull Salzburg's 20-year-old German forward Karim Adeyemi, who has been linked with a move to Liverpool.

Tottenham retain an interest in signing Inter Milan's Lautaro Martinez this summer after trying to sign him in January, although they are set to face competition from Atletico Madrid for the Argentina striker, 24.
