Leeds United have stepped up their interest in versatile Croatia defender Josko Gvardiol having gone close to signing the 20-year-old when he left Dinamo Zagreb for RB Leipzig in 2020.
Manchester City are still waiting to hear back on their new contract offers to Algeria winger Riyad Mahrez, 31, England forward Raheem Sterling, 27, and Brazil forward Gabriel Jesus, 25.
Brentford have spoken to Shakhtar Donetsk about signing Ukrainian pair, 21-year-old winger Mykhaylo Mudryk and left-sided defender Mykola Matviyenko, 25, this summer.
Italy international Andrea Belotti, 28, "may well have already signed for another club", according to Torino president Urbano Cairo. Belotti's contract at the Serie A club runs out in the summer.
Newcastle have offered Benfica 60m euros (Â£50m) for Uruguay striker Darwin Nunez, 22, to try to fend off a queue of Premier League rivals vying to sign him.
Coach Maurizio Sarri is desperate for a reunion with Jorginho at Lazio, with the Italy midfielder, 30, unlikely to be offered a new contract at Chelsea beyond 2023.
Incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag wants Monaco's France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni and the 22-year-old favours a move away from Ligue 1.
Manchester United are monitoring River Plate's Argentine midfielder Enzo Fernandez, 21.
Inter Miami co-owner David Beckham wants to bring Paris St-Germain's Spain defender Sergio Ramos, 36, to the club this summer.
Arsenal are interested in signing Hoffenheim's Austria midfielder Florian Grillitsch, 26, on a free transfer this summer.
Leeds United have joined Arsenal and Newcastle United in expressing an interest in Grillitsch.
England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, wants to stay at Leeds and will reject Manchester United's advances by signing a new contract
Tottenham will be in the market for a left-sided centre-back this summer and are monitoring the situation of Spain defender Mario Hermoso, 26, at Atletico Madrid.
Burnley want to bring in Sam Allardyce to replace Sean Dyche as manager following his sacking on Friday.
Borussia Dortmund have reached a basic agreement with Red Bull Salzburg over signing Karim Adeyemi but the Germany forward, 20, is still in talks with Liverpool, RB Leipzig and Paris St-Germain.
Manchester United had a scout at RB Leipzig's Europa League win on Thursday to watch France striker Christopher Nkunku, 24, who scored another two goals to reach 30 this season.
Chelsea's second-choice Spanish goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, 27, is a target for Juventus.
Tottenham are confident of securing a deal for England-capped West Bromwich Albion keeper Sam Johnstone, 29, despite interest from Manchester United.
Barcelona have stepped up their pursuit of Chelsea captain Cesar Azpilicueta, 32, with the Spain defender pushing to leave amid ongoing financial uncertainty at Stamford Bridge.
Paolo Dybala, 28, is planning talks with both Arsenal and Tottenham as the Argentina forward's contract at Juventus is due to expire in the summer

A long list of European and Premier League clubs are lining up to bid for Torino's Brazilian centre-back Gleison Bremer, with Arsenal, Leicester, Everton and Newcastle having contacted the Serie A club. Tottenham and Atletico Madrid have sent scouts to Turin, and Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund are also monitoring the 25-year-old.
Belgium midfielder Eden Hazard, 31, does not want to leave Real Madrid this summer, despite Arsenal, AC Milan and Borussia Dortmund being cited as potential buyers.

Manchester City are still pursuing Erling Braut Haaland, 21, but would prefer to avoid triggering the Norway striker's Â£63m release clause, which they would have to pay in one lump sum. Instead they want to agree a deal with Borussia Dortmund which would see them pay more but over more than one payment.
The Gunners' Brazil defender Gabriel Magalhaes, 24, says he is happy and focused at the Emirates, amid rumours of Barcelona interest.
Fenerbahce and Galatasaray want to sign Al Rayyan's James Rodriguez this summer but the Colombia winger, 30, is interested in joining Atletico Madrid.
Chelsea are prepared to let 28-year-old Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku leave this summer, with Inter Milan and Paris St-Germain interested in signing him.
Manchester United have placed a Â£40m price tag on England goalkeeper Dean Henderson, 25, who is keen to leave this summer. Newcastle are among the potential bidders.
Manchester United will pay some of Henderson's Â£120,000-a-week wages if he leaves on loan.

Incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag will bring his Ajax assistant Mitchell van der Gaag with him, but former United striker Robin van Persie remains undecided over an offer to join the backroom team.
Manchester United are targeting Everton 19-year-old English centre-back Jarrad Branthwaite.
West Ham's French defender Issa Diop, 25, has emerged as a transfer target for Lyon.
Manchester City have held more talks over their proposed move for Borussia Dortmund's 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland.
Real Madrid have made a late move to capture Borussia Dortmund's Erling Braut Haaland from under the noses of the Premier League side.

Roma are considering letting Italy midfielder Nicolo Zaniolo, 22, leave at the end of the season and would consider an offer of about 60m euros (Â£50m) amid interest from Serie A and Premier League clubs.
Portuguese side Braga want Juventus great Andrea Pirlo, 42, to be their manager next season.
Liverpool are chasing Aberdeen's 18-year-old Scottish right-back Calvin Ramsay as cover for Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Brentford's German midfielder Vitaly Janelt, 23, says he has had contact from Premier League and Bundesliga sides about a potential move after impressing this season.
Paris Saint-Germain are ready to part ways with Mauricio Pochettino and hope to appoint Zinedine Zidane as their new head coach.
Juventus could launch a bid for Chelsea's Italy midfielder Jorginho, 30 as they look to strengthen their midfield for next season.
Barcelona are back in the frame to sign Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez, 24, from Inter Milan, who are willing to drop their asking price if they can receive a player as part of the deal.

Barcelona will speak with representatives of Brazil winger Philippe Coutinho this week to decide on the player's future. The 29-year-old is on loan at Aston Villa but Barca are unconvinced the Premier League club will pay the Â£33m fee written into his loan agreement.
Bayern Munich's Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, remains a potential target for Barcelona, but they need to offload players to have any chance of signing him.
Crystal Palace and Tottenham want to sign Peterborough's Â£15m-rated 19-year-old defender Ronnie Edwards.
Hoffenheim's Austria midfielder Florian Grillitsch, 26, could be a target for Leeds if England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, moves on this summer.
Derby manager Wayne Rooney wants to bring Burnley's former Scotland defender Phil Bardsley, 36, to Pride Park if the Rams avoid relegation from the Championship.
Liverpool are planning to offer Senegal international Sadio Mane a new contract. The 30-year-old forward's current deal ends in 12 months.
Liverpool have sounded out 17-year-old Barcelona and Spain midfielder Gavi over a possible summer move.
Borussia Dortmund chief Sebastian Kehl says Manchester City have not agreed a deal to sign Norwegian striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21.

Bayern Munich chief executive Oliver Kahn says the club do not have the financial might to sign Haaland. Kahn also confirmed the club are in contract negotiations with Polish forward Robert Lewandowski, 33.
West Ham are lining up a bid for Manchester United's English defender Di'Shon Bernard. The 21-year-old is currently on loan at Hull.
Tottenham are monitoring their former player and current Brentford midfielder Christian Eriksen, 30. The Dane would be keen on a return to Spurs.
Arsenal are planning a move for Lille's Kosovan winger Edon Zhegrova, 23.
However, the Gunners could miss out on RB Leipzig midfielder Christopher Nkunku with Inter Milan now pushing to land the 24-year-old Frenchman.
Arsenal could let as many as 12 players leave this summer with Germany goalkeeper Bernd Leno, 30, Spain defender Hector Bellerin, 27, and France forward Alexandre Lacazette, 30, all set to depart.
Everton and Brazil forward Richarlison, 24, has told his agents to find him a new club.
Newcastle are prepared to revive their interest in Torino defender Gleison Bremer. The 25-year-old Brazilian has also attracted interest from Arsenal and Tottenham.
Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti says Croatia midfielder Luka Modric will finish his career at the club. The 36-year-old has been linked with moves to Newcastle and Manchester City.
Roma boss Jose Mourinho has visited a mural dedicated to Argentine legend Diego Maradona in Naples prior to his side's Serie A match against Napoli on Monday evening.

Manchester United players have been warned to expect a "highly demanding" culture under potential new manager Erik ten Hag by Dutch defender Willem Janssen, who played under the current Ajax boss when he was in charge of FC Utrecht.
Manchester City have agreed personal terms with Borussia Dortmund and Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21.
City are poised to trigger the Â£62m release clause in Haaland's contract
Real Madrid are reluctant to meet Haaland's wage demands because they do not want to unsettle their dressing room of stars by making the striker the highest-paid player in the squad.
If a deal for Haaland does not materialise, Real may target Manchester United and Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, 35, instead.
Real are closely monitoring Chelsea wing-back Reece James, 22, with Carlo Ancelotti's scouts watching the England defender nine times this season.
RB Leipzig have put a Â£54m price tag on Manchester United target Christopher Nkunku. The 24-year-old France midfielder has scored 17 goals in 30 Bundesliga games this season.
Paris St-Germain are hoping to sell Argentina striker Mauro Icardi, 29, and his compatriot Leandro Paredes, 27, in the summer.
Uruguayan striker Luis Suarez, 35, could be set for a reunion with former Liverpool team-mate Steven Gerrard at Aston Villa, when his contract at Atletico Madrid expires in the summer.
West Ham are considering a summer move for England and Burnley goalkeeper Nick Pope, 29.
His former side Lyon are among the clubs Arsenal striker Alexandre Lacazette, 30, is in talks with about a free-agent move in the summer.
Inter Milan's directors are open to taking back Chelsea and Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, on a loan deal.

Juventus want to take Paul Pogba, 29, back to Turin on a free transfer when his Manchester United contract expires in the summer - but they will face fierce competition from Paris St-Germain and Real Madrid for the France midfielder.
Liverpool target Serge Gnabry, 26, is in talks with Bayern Munich over a contract extension. The Bundesliga club are keen to hold on to the Germany forward, whose contract expires next year.

Matt Targett wants Newcastle United to make his loan move from Aston Villa permanent. The 26-year-old English left-back is keen to be part of Eddie Howe's project despite having three years left on his Villa contract.
Newcastle are in prime position to sign Rangers' 18-year-old youth team product Alex Lowry after the Scottish midfielder's agent held talks with the Magpies' head of recruitment.
Tunisia want France-born Southampton defender Yan Valery, 23, to switch international allegiance and play for them at the World Cup in Qatar. Valery is eligible as his mother is Tunisian.

Arsenal lead the pack of Premier League suitors tracking 26-year-old Spain winger Marco Asensio of Real Madrid. AC Milan appeared to be in the driving seat for his signature, but the Serie A club rejected his wage demands.

Manchester United and Erik ten Hag are close to completing their negotiations but will wait to announce the deal officially until a 2m euro (Â£1.6m) compensation clause for the Dutch manager has been agreed with his current club Ajax.
Real Madrid are looking into the possibility of signing Chelsea defender Antonio Rudiger, 29, on a free transfer when the Germany centre-back's contract expires at the end of June.
Rudiger turned down Manchester United after they held talks with his representatives. His priority is a club guaranteed to qualify for next season's Champions League.
Aaron Ramsey's loan move from Juventus to Rangers will not be made permanent after the 31-year-old Wales midfielder suffered another injury in the Scottish Cup semi-final against Celtic.

Fulham want Arsenal's England Under-21 striker Folarin Balogun on loan next year, with the Cottagers on the brink of promotion to the Premier League. The 20-year-old United States-born forward is on a season-long loan at Middlesbrough.
West Ham are set to trigger the one-year extension built into the contract of Italy centre-back Angelo Ogbonna, 33, when it expires at the end of the season.
Norwich City have revived their interest in Aston Villa's 24-year-old English striker Keinan Davis, currently on loan at Nottingham Forest.
AS Monaco sporting director Paul Mitchell is being closely monitored by parties interested in buying Chelsea, who see him as a potential technical director at Stamford Bridge.
Manchester City and England forward Raheem Sterling, 27, is on a list of players AC Milan want to sign amid reports of a potential Â£850m takeover of the 18-time champions of Italy.

Manchester City have told Dortmund and Norway striker Erling Braut Haaland, 21, that he could join Real Madrid later in his career if he moves to the Etihad this summer. The signing-on fee and agent commission on a potential deal could add Â£40m to the Â£63m transfer fee stipulated by Haaland's release clause.
Real Madrid and Barcelona are both interested in signing Chelsea and Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, 29, who is out of contract at the end of the season but is keen to stay at Stamford Bridge.
Lazio, Juventus and AC Milan could all be destinations for Chelsea and Italy midfielder Jorginho, 30, who is unlikely to be offered an extension to a contract that expires at the end of next season.

Manchester United will have to qualify for the Champions League if they want to sign RB Leipzig and France forward Christopher Nkunku, 24. Nkunku is on United's radar after 30 goals in 44 games this season.
Meanwhile, Manchester United have revived their interest in signing Villarreal's Spain defender Pau Torres, 25, this summer.
Former Red Devils boss Jose Mourinho is keen to bring Nemanja Matic to Roma after the Manchester United and Serbia midfielder, 33, announced he was leaving Old Trafford.
Newcastle's French attacker Allan Saint-Maximin, 25, has kept open the possibility for leaving the club this summer.

Tottenham are confident of keeping England forward Harry Kane, 28, this summer and considering a move to bring Brentford and Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen, 30, back to the club. Spurs are also keeping tabs on 24-year-old Leicester and Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans.

Newcastle are set to end their interest in Benfica's Darwin Nunez, 22, as the Uruguay forward wants to join a Champions League club, with Brentford's English striker Ivan Toney, 26, viewed as an alternative.
Arsenal and France defender William Saliba, 21, says there is a chance he could stay on loan at Marseille beyond the end of the season.
However, Atletico Madrid are keen on signing Saliba, who joined Arsenal in 2019 from Saint-Etienne.
Arsenal's England Under-21 forward Eddie Nketiah, 22, wants regular first-team football and has been linked with Leeds, Crystal Palace and West Ham.
Brighton have made an approach to sign Arsenal forward Khayon Edwards, 18, who has scored 17 goals and provided six assists in 22 appearances for the academy. Edwards is also wanted by Chelsea.
Tottenham are keen on signing Roma and Italy midfielder Nicolo Zaniolo, 22.
Bayern Munich are close to completing a deal to sign Ajax and Morocco right-back Noussair Mazraoui, 24.
Crystal Palace's Spanish keeper Vicente Guaita, 35, wants to return to Valencia, where he came through the academy, before he retires from playing.
Former Norwich boss Daniel Farke has emerged as a contender to replace Sean Dyche at Burnley while ex-West Ham and West Brom boss Slaven Bilic is also interested in the job.

Real Madrid are confident of signing Kylian Mbappe, 23, and will go all out for the Paris St-Germain and France forward after conceding that their other main target, Erling Braut Haaland, is heading to Manchester City.
RealMadrid are keen on bringing England midfielder Jude Bellingham to the Bernabeu, but Borussia Dortmund are desperate to keep the 18-year-old.
Everton are monitoring Wolves' Spain winger Adama Traore, 26, with a view to signing him if Barcelona reject the option to make his loan move permanent.
Incoming Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag will have Â£200m to spend on signings, with at least six first-team players set to leave in the summer.
France forward Anthony Martial, 26, looks likely to return to Manchester United after a season-long loan at Sevilla.
Manchester United's France midfielder Paul Pogba's representatives are in talks with Juventus and Real Madrid about a summer move, when the 29-year-old becomes a free agent.
Nemanja Matic, the 33-year-old former Serbia midfielder who has said he will leave Manchester United this summer, is open to joining Roma.
Manchester United and Arsenal are interested in RB Leipzig's 24-year-old France forward Christopher Nkunku.
Arsenal are targeting Bayern Munich's Austria midfielder Marcel Sabitzer, 28, but Atletico Madrid are also keen.
Tottenham manager Antonio Conte is set for talks with chairman Daniel Levy to tell him the club need six summer signings, with Leicester's Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans, 24, high on the list.
West Brom's England goalkeeper Sam Johnstone, 29, is keen to join Tottenham this summer.
English right-back Djed Spence, 21, currently on loan at Nottingham Forest from Middlesbrough, is also wanted by Tottenham.
Tottenham will make Sweden winger Dejan Kulusevski a permanent signing in the summer. The 21-year-old is on an 18-month loan and Spurs have decided to pay Juventus the Â£25m fee this summer.
Portuguese winger Fabio Carvalho, 19, says Liverpool's interest in signing him has affected his recent Fulham performances.
Ivan Toney wants a new deal and pay rise at Brentford, where the 26-year-old English striker is under contract until 2025.
Torino's defensive pair, Brazilian Gleison Bremer, 25, and Ivory Coast international Wilfried Singo, 21, are targets for Tottenham director of football Fabio Paratici.
Leeds and Everton are lining up moves for Chelsea's 28-year-old Belgium striker Michy Batshuayi, who is on loan at Besiktas.
West Ham are interested in Club Bruges's 22-year-old Netherlands winger Noa Lang, but face competition from AC Milan.
Birmingham City have told Wolves they want to sign Montenegro keeper Matija Sarkic, 24, on a permanent deal after his impressive loan spell at St Andrews.
Barcelona could move for Manchester United and England striker Marcus Rashford, 24.

Manchester United could sell Rashford, France forward Anthony Martial, English right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Ivory Coast centre-back Eric Bailly, ex-England defender Phil Jones and Brazil left-back Alex Telles this summer as part of the overhaul under new manager Erik ten Hag.
West Ham's England midfielder Declan Rice, 25, is high on Ten Hag's transfer wish-list at Manchester United.
Netherlands midfielder Donny van de Beek, 25, is set to be handed the chance to revive his Old Trafford career by his former Ajax boss, when his current loan at Everton ends.
A new centre-back, two central midfielders, a winger and a striker will be Manchester United's top transfer priorities this summer.
Manchester United have refused Ten Hag's request to bring Sir Alex Ferguson's former assistant Steve McClaren back to the club as part of his coaching team.
Bruges boss Alfred Schreuder is the leading contender to replace Ten Hag at Ajax.
Real Madrid and Wales forward Gareth Bale, 32, is in talks over a move to MLS side DC United.
RB Leipzig have again insisted France attacking midfielder Christopher Nkunku, 24, will still be their player next season, despite interest from Manchester United and Arsenal.
Crystal Palace and Borussia Monchengladbach are interested in Arsenal's 22-year-old English forward Eddie Nketiah.
AC Milan could move for Chelsea and Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28.
Burnley have made interim Wales manager Robert Page their number-one target to replace Sean Dyche.
Brentford and Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen, 30, has agreed to rejoin former club Tottenham in the summer.
Everton have joined Tottenham in the race to sign 29-year-old West Brom and England goalkeeper Sam Johnstone.
Real Madrid are monitoring Newcastle and Brazil midfielder Bruno Guimaraes, 24.
Besiktas and Turkey left-back Ridvan Yilmaz, 20, is being eyed by Tottenham and a host of European clubs.
Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard was casting an eye over Marseille's French defensive midfielder Boubacar Kamara, 22, when he watched the French club's win over Nantes on Wednesday.
Villa are keen on making their loan signing of 32-year-old Roma and Sweden goalkeeper Robin Olsen permanent.
Paris St-Germain and Argentina winger Angel di Maria, 34, is wanted by Juventus when his contract expires in the summer.
Leicester City are trying to beat Tottenham to the signing of Brazil centre-back Gleison Bremer, 25, from Italian side Torino.
Aberdeen right-back Calvin Ramsay, 18, is being monitored by Liverpool following an impressive breakthrough season for the Scotland Under-21 international.
Manchester City and Newcastle are both pursuing a move for 18-year-old Rangers midfielder Alex Lowry.

Arsenal are looking to bring Manchester City striker Gabriel Jesus, 25, to Emirates Stadium, with the Gunners' technical director Edu having held discussions with the Brazil international's representatives.

Mohamed Salah wants to stay at Liverpool but his long-term future is uncertain with no agreement reached on contract negotiations and the 29-year-old Egypt forward saying money is not the only factor.

Paris St-Germain have made France striker Kylian Mbappe, 23, a contract offer worth 50m euros (Â£42m) a year, which would make him the club's highest earner. His much reported move to Real Madrid has reportedly stalled over the player's image rights.
Mbappe's mother and representative Fayza Lamari is in Qatar holding talks with PSG's owners
Tottenham boss Antonio Conte is keen on managing PSG next season and is confident of replacing former Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino at Parc des Princes.

Newcastle are preparing a move for PSG goalkeeper Keylor Navas, who will leave the Ligue 1 leaders in the summer, but the 35-year-old Costa Rica veteran is also attracting interest from Juventus and Sevilla.

Declan Rice has turned down a third contract offer from West Ham worth a reported Â£200,000 a week. Despite the Hammers insisting the England midfielder is not for sale it is understood they would accept Â£150m for the 23-year-old, a target for both Manchester United and Chelsea.
West Ham are weighing up a move for Fiorentina's Polish goalkeeper Bartlomiej Dragowski, 29, as David Moyes searches for Lukasz Fabianski's long-term successor.
Tottenham have made contact with Inter Milan about signing the Netherlands right-back Denzel Dumfries, 26.
Celtic are at advanced stages of talks with Tottenham to sign their United States centre-back Cameron Carter-Vickers, 24, on a permanent deal. (
Another Tottenham defender, Wales international Joe Rodon, 24, has been told he can leave the club.
Newcastle are tracking Monaco's French defender, Benoit Badiashile, 21, and Bayer Leverkusen's France winger Moussa Diaby, 22.

Chelsea defender Antonio Rudiger has ruled out moving to Manchester United. The 29-year-old Germany international becomes a free agent in the summer but is only considering clubs in next season's Champions League.
Wayne Rooney turned down an offer to work under Erik ten Hag at Manchester United, insisting he would only leave Derby County for a managerial role.
Fulham want to bring Lazio and Serbia midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, 27, to Craven Cottage.

Former Manchester United, West Ham and Manchester City forward Carlos Tevez could make a shock return to football nearly a year after the 38-year-old played his last game for Boca Juniors. The Argentine has visited AC Milan, Juventus and Tottenham as well as his old club West Ham.
Leicester and Aston Villa are interested in signing former Manchester City youth team product and Fulham loanee Seko Fofana, 26. The Ivorian midfielder is currently on the books at Lens.
Barcelona have ruled out approaching Arsenal's Brazilian defender Gabriel Magalhaes, 24, for financial reasons.
Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen, 30, is wanted by incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag. Eriksen is currently on a six-month deal at Brentford that concludes at the end of the season.
Manchester City are set to battle with Manchester United to sign West Ham and England midfielder Declan Rice, 23.
Arsenal are set to renew their interest in England striker Tammy Abraham, 24, this summer and will offer Roma Â£50m in an attempt to seal a deal.
West Ham have joined the bidding for Torino and Italy striker Andrea Belotti, 28.
Real Madrid are leading the race to sign 29-year-old Germany defender Antonio Rudiger, who is out of contract at Chelsea at the end of the season.
Rudiger turned down an offer of Â£200,000 a week to stay at Stamford Bridge.
Talks between Kylian Mbappe's representatives and Paris St-Germain over a new contract for the 23-year-old forward are moving in a positive direction.
Tottenham could make a summer move for Bayern Munich and Germany star Serge Gnabry, 26, a former Arsenal winger.
Barcelona manager Xavi says he wants to keep Dutch midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 24, who has been linked with a move to Manchester United that would reunite him with former boss Erik ten Hag.
Leicester want to sign PSV Eindhoven midfielder Ibrahim Sangare, 24. The Ivory Coast international would cost at least Â£30m.
West Ham will attempt to sign centre-back Michael Keane, 29, from Everton if the Toffees are relegated from the Premier League this season.
Tottenham and Leeds have scouted Bristol City's Â£10m English midfielder Alex Scott, 18.
Arsenal will focus on signing "one or two" players this summer, says technical director Edu.
Crystal Palace are considering a move for 18-year-old English striker Malcolm Ebiowei, who will be a free agent at the end of the season after leaving Derby.
Brentford are competing with West Ham to sign Hull City's England Under-21 forward Keane Lewis-Potter, 21.
Juventus have made contact with the representatives of 34-year-old Paris St-Germain winger Angel di Maria.
Aston Villa have stepped up their plans to sign Marseille centre-back Duje Caleta-Car after manager Steven Gerrard went to watch the 25-year-old play.
Napoli want at least 80m euros (Â£67m) if they are to consider selling 23-year-old striker Victor Osimhen, who is among Arsenal's targets for the summer.
Atletico Madrid midfielder Rodrigo de Paul, 27, wants a move back to Italy and is being tracked by Inter Milan.
Celtic are in talks to sign Tottenham centre-back Cameron Carter-Vickers, 24, on a permanent deal.
Manchester City are considering a move for West Ham's England midfielder Declan Rice, 23, who has also been a long-term target for Manchester United and Chelsea.

Paris St-Germain's France striker Kylian Mbappe, 23, has been linked with a move to Real Madrid in the summer, but he will not make an announcement on his future until after the final game of the season against Metz on 21 May.
Norwich City want to sign Bristol City's English midfielder Alex Scott, with Tottenham and Leeds already monitoring the 18-year-old.
Barcelona would be willing to let Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 24, leave for a fee of 70m euros (Â£58m), with Manchester United interested.
Manchester United could offer Barcelona 24-year-old England forward Marcus Rashford and 29-year-old Brazil defender Alex Telles in exchange for Frenkie de Jong.
New Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag will hold one-to-one Zoom meetings with every member of the squad to assess who he wants to keep before he takes charge in June.
Ten Hag will be given "significant funds" to shape his Manchester United squad, with a striker and midfielder the priority.
One player leaving Manchester United is 29-year-old France midfielder Paul Pogba, who has left the team's WhatsApp group after receiving offers from Real Madrid and Paris St-Germain.
Paris St-Germain will keep Argentina forward Lionel Messi, 34, for one more season but are open to letting Brazil forward Neymar, 30, leave.
AC Milan are close to reaching a deal with Liverpool's 27-year-old Belgium striker Divock Origi.
AC Milan, Chelsea and Real Madrid are interested in Manchester City's 31-year-old Algeria winger Riyad Mahrez.
Juventus are in talks to sign Argentina forward Angel di Maria, 34, on a free transfer this summer after Paris St-Germain opted not to extend his contract.
West Ham will open talks with Hull City to sign Keane Lewis-Potter. Hull, who value the 21-year-old English forward at Â£18m, have rejected a Â£12m offer from Brentford.
Reims will let 19-year-old French striker Hugo Ekitike leave for 35m euros (Â£30m) in the summer. Newcastle are expected to revive their interest after talks with the youngster in January.
Ekitike has also had interest from Liverpool, Chelsea and Manchester United.
Arsenal are prepared to listen to offers for 26-year-old Ivory Coast winger Nicolas Pepe.

Germany midfielder Ilkay Gundogan, 31, says he would be happy to end his career at Manchester City, but would also be interested in a move to the Turkish Superlig or MLS when his contract ends in 2023.
Liverpool's 21-year-old defender Neco Williams, who is on loan at Fulham, says he does not know where he will be playing next season.
Udinese want to sign Arsenal's Spanish defender Pablo Mari, 28, on a permanent deal, following his loan spell.
Newcastle have Eintracht Frankfurt's 22-year-old French defender Evan Ndicka on their radar.

Paris St-Germain are increasingly hopeful that France striker Kylian Mbappe, who has been linked with Real Madrid, will sign a new deal with them following talks with the 23-year-old's mother last week.
Liverpool have made contact with France and Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni, 22.
Manchester United plan to open talks over a new contract with 31-year-old Spanish goalkeeper David de Gea.
Manchester United could move for Ivory Coast international Sebastien Haller, 27. The striker currently plays for incoming United manager Erik ten Hag at Ajax.
Dutch midfielder Donny van de Beek, 25, will be given a chance at Manchester United next season by Ten Hag.
Manchester City and Brazil striker Gabriel Jesus, 25, has begun talks with Arsenal.
Arsenal will have to play 80m euros (Â£67.7m) to sign England striker Tammy Abraham, 24, from Roma.
Abraham has reiterated his desire to stay at Roma after moving from Chelsea last summer.
France defender Jules Kounde wants to leave Sevilla in the summer and the 23-year-old keen on a move to Chelsea.
Chelsea are keeping tabs on German defender Amos Pieper, 24, whose contract at Bundesliga side Arminia Bielefeld runs out at the end of the season.
Newcastle are eyeing a move for Tottenham and Denmark midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, 26.
Eddie Howe's side are also pursuing Reims and France Under-20 international Hugo Ekitike, 19.
The Magpies are interested in French defender Evan Ndicka, 22, who plays for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Wolves and Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25, is "crazy" about joining Barcelona.
There is optimism at Barcelona that Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, could join from Bayern Munich this summer.
Croatia international Luka Modric, 36, is set to sign another deal at Real Madrid, running until 2023.
Leeds United will target a move for Wales forward Brennan Johnson if they stay in the Premier League and Nottingham Forest, where the 20-year-old plays, fail to earn promotion from the Championship.
Newcastle United are on the verge of giving Switzerland defender Fabian Schar a contract extension, with the 30-year-old's current deal running out in the summer.
English full-back Ashley Young is keen to extend his contract with Aston Villa by another year, with the 36-year-old having joined the Midlands club from Inter Milan last summer.
Villa are in talks to sign Hearts' 15-year-old Scottish midfielder Ewan Simpson.
Manchester United are considering a Â£50m move for Leeds United and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, this summer.
Borussia Dortmund will compete with Manchester United for the signature of Ajax and Ivory Coast striker Sebastien Haller, 27.
Bayern Munich are also looking at the possibility of signing Haller if Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33, leaves them to join Barcelona in the summer.
Barcelona are working hard to sign Lewandowski but no opening bid has been made yet for forward.

Bayern Munich want to be kept informed of Dutch midfielder Frenkie de Jong's situation at Barcelona. The Spanish club could sell the 24-year-old, who has also been linked with Manchester United and Paris St-Germain, depending on the size of the offer they receive.
Arsenal will hold talks at the end of the season with club record signing Nicolas Pepe, 26, over the Ivory Coast winger's future.
Everton and England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 25, would prefer a move to Arsenal over Newcastle. (
France forward Ousmane Dembele is prepared to reduce his salary demands as talks take place regarding a new deal at Barcelona. The 24-year-old's current contract runs out in the summer.
Former Everton forward James Rodriguez, 30, is eyeing a return to Europe and the Colombian will drop his wage demands to force through a move.
Manchester United know this summer could be their best chance to move for England international Declan Rice, with their rivals for the 23-year-old West Ham midfielder prioritising other positions.

Roma are looking to the Premier League this summer. The Serie A team are interested in Arsenal and Switzerland midfielder Granit Xhaka, 29, Aston Villa's Brazil midfielder Douglas Luiz, 23, and Manchester United's departing Serbian midfielder Nemanja Matic, 33.
England striker Tammy Abraham, 24, says he is "happy" at Roma but, having been linked with a move to Arsenal, has refused to rule out leaving the Serie A side.
Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves is ready to leave Wolves in the summer, with Arsenal, Manchester United, Tottenham, Atletico Madrid and Barcelona among the sides monitoring the 25-year-old.
Villarreal manager Unai Emery is interested in taking Watford's Nigerian striker Emmanuel Dennis, 24, to Spain this summer.
Liverpool and Spain midfielder Thiago Alcantara, 31, wanted to join Manchester United prior to his move to Anfield, says Rio Ferdinand.
Arsenal's 21-year-old France defender William Saliba - currently on loan at Marseille - plans to return to the Gunners this summer and fight for his place in Mikel Arteta's side.
Wolves want to sign Valencia's Portugal striker Goncalo Guedes, 25.
Oxford United's English midfielder Cameron Brannagan, 25, is attracting interest from Sheffield United, QPR, Stoke, Preston and Blackpool.
Arsenal have registered their interest in signing Manchester United and England forward Marcus Rashford, 24.
Derby manager Wayne Rooney is Burnley's top choice to replace former boss Sean Dyche.
Incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag wants to sign Juventus and Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, 28.
Manchester United have indicated to Napoli they are willing to pay Â£84m for 23-year-old Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen.

Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski, whose contract runs out in 2023, wants a new two-year deal as well as a wage increase. The 33-year-old Poland international has been linked with a move to Barcelona.
Liverpool are considering a summer move for Monaco's 22-year-old France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni.
Real Madrid want to sign Tchouameni and bring in 29-year-old France midfielder Paul Pogba, whose contract at Manchester United runs out in the summer.
Tottenham will listen to offers for Spain left-back Sergio Reguilon, 25, amid interest from an unnamed Spanish club.
Manchester United have been invited to bid for Wolves' Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25.
Crystal Palace are considering a loan move for Manchester United defender Aaron Wan-Bissaka. The 24-year-old came through the youth ranks at Palace and made 42 first-team appearances.
Southampton will not listen to offers for 27-year-old England midfielder James Ward-Prowse, who is believed to be of interest to Newcastle United and Tottenham.

Napoli have decided against signing Manchester United defender Axel Tuanzebe on a permanent deal. The 24-year-old has been on loan at the Serie A club since January but has made only one league appearance.
West Ham and Aston Villa are among the teams in contention to sign Colombia midfielder James Rodriguez, 30, from Qatari side Al Rayyan.
Galatasaray and Denmark centre-back Victor Nelsson, 23, has been linked with a move to Aston Villa.
Aberdeen have granted Leeds permission to speak to 18-year-old Scottish right-back Calvin Ramsay.
Norwich boss Dean Smith wants to sign Aston Villa's 20-year-old English striker Cameron Archer, who is on loan at Preston.
Premier League referees Martin Atkinson and Jonathan Moss will retire at the end of the season.

Barcelona will turn to Chelsea's Romelu Lukaku, 28, in their search for a striker. The Belgium centre-forward is believed to be Barca's 'plan C' after moves for Norway's Erling Haaland, 21, and Poland's Robert Lewandowski, 33, were thwarted.
Manchester City may consider the sale of 31-year-old Algeria forward Riyad Mahrez this summer.

Arsenal and Newcastle have joined the chase to sign Juventus and Argentina forward Paulo Dybala. The 28-year-old will leave Turin as a free agent in the summer and Manchester United and Tottenham have already made enquiries.
Arsenal have offered their Ivory Coast winger Nicolas Pepe, 26, to another Premier League club.
Pep Guardiola will not rush into extending his contract at Manchester City in the wake of Jurgen Klopp's new deal at rivals Liverpool. The 51-year-old Spaniard is under contract at City until 2023.
Manchester City remain focused on extending 21-year-old England midfielder Phil Foden's deal until 2027.
Former Manchester United defender Gary Neville says interim manager Ralf Rangnick should not take on a consultancy role at the club having accepted the chance to manage Austria.
Leeds United and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips is set to change his agent in a bid to secure a move away, with Manchester United working on a deal for the 26-year-old.
However, Phillips would reject a move to Manchester United out of loyalty to his boyhood club Leeds.
Liverpool could move for Borussia Dortmund's 19-year-old England midfielder Jude Bellingham, with several of their current players' contracts running down.
Lazio are considering a move for Chelsea and England midfielder Ruben Loftus-Cheek, 26.
Brighton manager Graham Potter intends to speak with Republic of Ireland defender Shane Duffy about his future when the season is over. The 30-year-old is under contract with Albion until 2023.
Meanwhile, Potter and former Manchester City boss Roberto Mancini are on Tottenham's managerial shortlist should Antonio Conte leave the club.

Napoli are set to move for Scotland left-back Aaron Hickey. Bologna have put an Â£18m price tag on the 19-year-old, who has also attracted attention from Serie A giants AC Milan and Juventus as well as Newcastle and Brentford.
Liverpool fans have moved to tweak the words of a chant to feature the name of Jurgen Klopp's wife after the German revealed she was key in his decision to extend his contract at Anfield.
Arsenal right-back Cedric Soares has no intention of leaving, despite reported interest from Newcastle and a Â£4.2m bid from Porto for the 30-year-old Portugal international.
Newcastle will bid to make their loan deal permanent for Aston Villa's 26-year-old English defender Matt Targett.
Southampton and Fulham are among a number of clubs interested in signing 24-year-old Tottenham and USA centre-back Cameron Carter-Vickers.
Barcelona are set to move for Celta Vigo's Spanish left-back Javi Galan, 27.
Manchester City believe manager Pep Guardiola will sign a new deal in the summer, with talks having taken place about extending the Spaniard's stay until 2025.

Manchester City and Manchester United are interested in signing England midfielder James Ward-Prowse from Southampton, while Arsenal, Newcastle United and Tottenham are monitoring developments concerning the 27-year-old.
Manchester United and Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo could return to Real Madrid.The Spanish giants are keen on signing the 37-year-old, who played for Real from 2009 to 2018.
Manchester City and Manchester United are also competing to sign Spain centre-back Pau Torres, 25, from Villarreal.
Erik ten Hag, who will leave Ajax to take over as Manchester United manager at the end of the season, wants to sign Feyenoord and Netherlands left-back Tyrell Malacia, 22, for the Old Trafford club.

Chelsea are concerned England midfielder Mason Mount will leave the club. Under current government sanctions, the Blues cannot offer the 23-year-old a new contract, with Manchester City and Liverpool thought to be interested in him.

Borussia Dortmund chief executive Hans-Joachim Watzke says the club beat Manchester United to the signing of Erling Haaland in December 2019 because they were prepared to put a release clause into the 21-year-old Norway international's contract.
Chelsea will look to offer 22-year-old England right-back Reece James, who has been linked with Real Madrid, an improved contract once they have new owners in place.
Dutch midfielder Frenkie de Jong has been linked with Manchester United but Barcelona boss Xavi says the 24-year-old is "the present and the future" at the Spanish club.

France forward Ousmane Dembele, 24, has a more lucrative offer from Paris St-Germain than current club Barcelona, but his preference is to stay at the Nou Camp where his contract runs out in the summer.
Real Madrid will take up a 40m euros (Â£33.5m) buyback option to sign Spain left-back Sergio Reguilon, 25, from Tottenham.
Wolves are open to selling 25-year-old Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, with the West Midlands club looking to bring in strikers and midfielders to add to their squad.
Crystal Palace are closing in on signing Lens and Mali midfielder Cheick Doucoure, 22.

Everton are interested in signing 29-year-old England centre-back James Tarkowski, whose contract at Burnley runs out in the summer, if the Goodison Park club avoid relegation from the Premier League.
Crystal Palace, Watford and Fulham are monitoring FC Koln's 25-year-old German defender Timo Hubers, who has also been linked with Leeds United.
Newcastle United have offered English midfielder Sean Longstaff a four-year contract, with the 24-year-old's current deal running out in the summer.
AC Milan have agreed a deal with Lille to sign Portugal midfielder Renato Sanches, 24, for about 20m euros (Â£16.8m) and add-ons worth up to 5m euros.
Netherlands defender Sven Botman, 22, has been linked with Newcastle United and AC Milan and says he expects this season to be his last at Lille.

England striker Marcus Rashford, 24, has been linked with leaving Manchester United, but will get a chance to prove himself under Erik ten Hag, who will take over as manager at the end of the season. England midfielder Jesse Lingard, 29, could also stay at the club.
Arsenal's Brazilian defender Gabriel Magalhaes, 24, is a summer transfer target for Italian club Juventus.
Former England midfielder James Milner, 36, has been offered another one-year contract at Liverpool but the future of Egyptian striker Mohamed Salah, 29, at the the club remains uncertain.
Barcelona director Mateu Alemany has denied the La Liga club has met with Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski's agent about a summer move for the 33-year-old Poland international.
Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans, who has a contract with Leicester City until 2023, would prefer a move to Spain if he left the Foxes. Real Madrid are believed to be interested in the 24-year-old.

West Ham midfielder Declan Rice has been linked with Chelsea, Manchester City and Manchester United but the 23-year-old England international says "it's important not to get too carried away with that".

Manchester United sent a senior scout to watch Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves play for Wolves in the their 3-0 defeat to Brighton on Saturday. The Old Trafford club are said to be interested in the 25-year-old.
Juventus have offered Chelsea midfielder Jorginho a return to Serie A, with the 30-year-old Italy international's contract with the Blues ending in 2023.
Chelsea left-back Marcos Alonso is one of the options Barcelona are looking at signing for their defence, with the 31-year-old keen to return to his native Spain during the summer.
Tottenham will not look to sign goalkeeper Pierluigi Gollini on a permanent deal when the 27-year-old Italian's loan from Atalanta expires at the end of the season.
French defender William Saliba, 21, who has been on loan at Marseille from Arsenal has suggested he is keen to remain in France next season.
Napoli have set their sights on 20-year-old Chelsea striker Armando Broja, with the Albania forward having impressed while on loan at Southampton this season.
Reading's interim manager Paul Ince, who has saved the Championship side from relegation this season, will meet the club's owner, Dai Yongge, this week to discuss his future.
Manchester United will have a free run at signing England midfielder Declan Rice, 23, from West Ham, with rivals focusing on strengthening other areas.
Everton would accept a fee of Â£50m for Brazil forward Richarlison, 24, this summer and are confident of getting such an offer.
AC Milan and Juventus lead the race to sign Manchester United and England midfielder Jesse Lingard, 29.
Arsenal have renewed their interest in Inter Milan and Argentina's 24-year-old forward Lautaro Martinez.
The Gunners will announce New England Revolution and United States goalkeeper Matt Turner, 27, as a summer signing in June.
Chelsea and Spain defenders Cesar Azpilicueta and Marcos Alonso, 32 and 31 respectively, want to join Barcelona.
Tottenham have targeted RB Leipzig and Croatia's Josko Gvardiol, 20, or Inter Milan and Italy's Alessandro Bastoni, 23, as a summer addition at centre-back.
RB Leipzig and Austria midfielder Konrad Laimer, 24, is a target for Tottenham and Liverpool, as well as Bayern Munich.
Lazio and Serbia's 27-year-old midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic has been discussed as a possible target for both Manchester United and Paris St-Germain.
Leeds will not make England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, a new contract offer until June.
Ajax will reignite their interest in Tottenham and Netherlands forward Steven Bergwijn after the 24-year-old said he was open to leaving the club.
Newcastle's former Wales international defender Paul Dummett, 30, is set to sign a new deal at the club.
Relegated Norwich are set to sell former England Under-21 defender Max Aarons, 22, this summer.
Barcelona will not sign Wolves winger Adama Traore, 26, permanently this summer. The Spain international is currently on loan at the La Liga side.
Tottenham, Leeds and Fulham are interested in Derby's former England Under-16 winger Malcolm Ebiowei, 18.
Newly promoted Fulham have made an approach to sign Sweden striker Viktor Gyokeres, 23, from Coventry City.
Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku has no interest in signing for AC Milan or Newcastle this summer, despite the 28-year-old's growing frustration at a lack of opportunities at Chelsea.

Barcelona will listen to big-money offers for Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong. Manchester United have been linked with the 24-year-old with Erik ten Hag, who coached De Jong at Ajax, taking over as Old Trafford boss this summer.

Erik ten Hag, meanwhile, has identified eight players he can trust when he begins his Manchester United reign. The Dutchman, 52, hopes to sign a left-sided centre-back to help England's Harry Maguire, 29, recapture his best form and is weighing up whether England striker Marcus Rashford can resurrect his career at the club.

Southampton and England midfielder James Ward-Prowse, 27, Feyenoord and Netherlands left-back Tyrell Malacia, 22, and West Ham's English winger Jarrod Bowen, 25 are also thought to be on a shortlist drawn up by Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag.

Newcastle have been scouting Benfica striker Darwin Nunez, the 22-year-old Uruguay international linked to Manchester United and Liverpool, as they look to bolster their attack. Everton's England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 25, and Bayer Leverkusen's Czech Republic forward Patrick Schick, 26, are other options.
Newcastle are also reportedly rivalling AC Milan and Inter Milan for the signing of Sassuolo and Italy striker Gianluca Scamacca, 23.
Juventus' 28-year-old Argentine striker Paulo Dybala, linked with Manchester United, Newcastle and Arsenal, will instead join Inter Milan when his contract expires in the summer.
Paris St-Germain are interested in Monaco and France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni, but the 22-year-old, who has been linked with Liverpool and Real Madrid, would prefer a move abroad.
Tottenham boss Antonio Conte is keen on bolstering his squad with the summer signings of Southampton's England midfielder James Ward-Prowse, 27, and Brighton's Spainleft-back Marc Cucurella, 23.
Aston Villa have been told by Barcelona they have until the end of May to decide whether they want to sign 29-year-old Brazil attacking midfielder Philippe Coutinho on a permanent deal this summer.
Manchester United have failed in an attempt to hijack Red Bull Salzburg striker Karim Adeyemi's move to Borussia Dortmund, with the 20-year-old German set on a move to the Bundesliga side.

Chelsea want to sign Croatia defender Josko Gvardiol, 20, from RB Leipzig with Germany's Antonio Rudiger, 29, and 26-year-old Dane Andreas Christensen expected to join Real Madrid and Barcelona respectively.

Arsenal are lining up a move for Bologna left-back Aaron Hickey, 19. Gunners boss Mikel Arteta is keen to bolster his defensive options and Scotland international Hickey has impressed for the Italian side since joining from Hearts in 2020.
Inter Milan are prepared to sell Stefan de Vrij for Â£15m this summer, with Tottenham, Aston Villa and Newcastle among the clubs interested in the 30-year-old Netherlands centre-back.
Newly-promoted Fulham could make a move to sign Liverpool's 24-year-old England defender Joe Gomez.
Fulham's 19-year-old Portugal Under-21 forward Fabio Carvalho has agreed to join Liverpool in the summer, says Cottagers director of football Tony Khan.

Arsenal will make one final attempt to tie English striker Eddie Nketiah down to a new contract with the 22-year-old, whose current deal expires at the end of June, attracting interest from clubs in England, France and Germany.

Lazio are willing to lower their asking price for Serbia midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic to around 80 million euro (Â£67.4m) with Manchester United and Paris St-Germain among the clubs interested in the 27-year-old.
Newcastle face competition from Paris St-Germain in the race to sign AC Milan's Portugal winger Rafael Leao, 22.
Barcelona have stepped up their bid to land Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, and are prepared to offer separate deals depending on whether Leeds United stay in the Premier League this season.
English midfielder Jesse Lingard, 29, is attracting interest from Juventus, Paris St-Germain, AC Milan and Newcastle as he prepares to leave Manchester United after 22 years.
Crystal Palace and Ivory Coast winger Wilfried Zaha, 29, is unlikely to sign a new deal at the club and could be sold in the summer because his contract expires in 2023.

Barcelona have no intention of paying the 30m euros (Â£25.3m) option to convert 26-year-old Spain winger Adama Traore's loan move from Wolves into a permanent deal and would only be interested in a player swap.
Arsenal are interested in signing Inter Milan and Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez, although the 24-year-old's agent has said the player "is not thinking about" leaving his current club.
The Gunners are also interested in signing Bayer Leverkusen's 22-year-old French winger Moussa Diaby.
Borussia Monchengladbach and Germany central defender Matthias Ginter, 28, rejected a summer move to Aston Villa and will join Freiburg instead.
The market value for Manchester United and England forward Marcus Rashford, who is linked with moves to Arsenal and Newcastle, has fallen by Â£90m since the start of 2021.
Newcastle have been offered the chance to sign Watford and Senegal attacker Ismaila Sarr, with the Hornets wanting Â£40m for the 24-year-old.
Liverpool are monitoring Aberdeen and Scotland Under-21 right back Calvin Ramsay, 18.
Brighton are interested in Coventry City's Dutch defensive midfielder Gustavo Hamer, 24.
West Ham risk missing out on the signing of Sparta Prague and Czech Republic forward Adam Hlozek, 19, despite being offered the chance to bring him on loan this summer.
Kylian Mbappe is on the brink of signing a two-year contract extension with Paris St-Germain worth Â£42.5m a year, plus an Â£85m signing-on fee for the 23-year-old France forward.
However, Mbappe's mother says her son is continuing talks about his future with PSG "in great serenity".
Manager Pep Guardiola will sign a new deal with Manchester City to keep him at the Etihad until 2025 after telling the club he is more determined than ever to win the Champions League.
Manchester City are considering a move for Barcelona's Dutch midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 25, as they look to build their squad for next season.
Everton are prepared to sell Jordan Pickford, 28, to fund a summer rebuild. Tottenham and Newcastle are monitoring the England goalkeeper's situation.

Tottenham officials watched Villarreal and Spain centre-back Pau Torres, 25, in their Champions League semi-final defeat on Tuesday. They also hoped to scout Dutch winger Arnaut Danjuma, also 25, but he was ruled out by injury.

Meanwhile, both Spurs and Leeds are interested in Wolves and Spain winger Adama Traore. The 26-year-old is currently on loan at Barcelona but the Spanish giants are not expected to sign him permanently.
England midfielder James Ward-Prowse is believed to be courting interest from Premier League clubs but Southampton boss Ralph Hasenhuttl insists the 27-year-old will be staying at Saints.
Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, 35, says he would have considered leaving Manchester United last summer if he had known the club were going to sign Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo, 37.
Napoli's 23-year-old Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen says he would prefer to join Arsenal over Manchester United or Newcastle.
Arsenal and Manchester United target Paolo Dybala has had an offer to join Borussia Dortmund when the 28-year-old Argentina forward's Juventus contract ends in the summer.
RB Leipzig want Manchester United target Christopher Nkunku, 24, to stay for one more season on an improved contract, with the Bundesliga club prepared to accept the France forward leaving in 2023.
Manchester United's Ivory Coast centre-back Eric Bailly, 28, and English defender Phil Jones, 30, have both told teammates they will leave the club in the summer.
Marcus Alonso's six-year stint with Chelsea will end this summer with the 31-year-old Spanish left-back prioritising a move to Spain, where Barcelona are interested.
Italy centre-back Giorgio Chiellini, 37, will head to the MLS when he leaves Juventus at the end of the season.
RedBird Capital Partners, which owns a minority stake in Fenway Sports Group, owners of Liverpool, is considering a purchase of AC Milan.
Leeds are targeting 25-year-old Eintracht Frankfurt and Japan midfielder Daichi Kamada.
Sporting Lisbon have triggered the buy option for Manchester City's on-loan Spanish right-back Pedro Porro, 22, who will complete a permanent deal with a buy-back clause for City.
Arsenal right-back Hector Bellerin, 27, will complete a permanent move to Real Betis for a fee of between Â£5m-Â£10m, after a successful loan spell and Copa del Rey victory with the Seville club.
West Ham have made a second approach to Leeds and Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, despite Barcelona being firm favourites to sign him.

Contract talks between Leeds and their sought after pair of Raphinha and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, are on hold until the Yorkshire club know their fate in their Premier League relegation battle.
Newcastle are ready to offer Atletico Madrid 25m euros (Â£21m) to acquire Brazil left-back Renan Lodi ahead of Juventus who are also tracking the 24-year-old.
Barcelona want to make a move for Manchester City's Portugal midfielder Bernardo Silva, 27, and could offer a swap deal involving 24-year-old Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong.
Brighton manager Graham Potter is favourite to replace Antonio Conte at Tottenham. Brighton would want Â£10m compensation from Spurs should Conte leave at the end of the season.
Conte has warned Spurs they will need to spend big in the summer or risk needing a "miracle" to catch other teams.
Incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag wants Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo to stay at the club. The 37-year-old has one year left on his contract at Old Trafford.
Manchester United are also interested in Reims' 19-year-old French striker Hugo Ekitike.
Chelsea are considering a move for Torino's Brazilian defender Gleison Bremer, 25.
Former Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is ready to return to management and has received approaches, including from other Premier League clubs.
Christian Eriksen is considering remaining at Brentford next season. The Denmark midfielder, 30, had been linked with a return to Tottenham and a move to Leicester.
France forward Kylian Mbappe, 23, will announce his final decision over whether he will leave Paris St-Germain in June.

Chelsea are frustrated they were unable to sign Borussia Dortmund and Norway striker Erling Haaland, 21. The club have been limited in the transfer marker because of sanctions against owner Roman Abramovich following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
Fulham manager Marco Silva says Portuguese forward Fabio Carvalho will not be at the newly promoted club next season. Liverpool have agreed a deal worth Â£7m for the 19-year-old.
Arsenal are interested in Juventus' Brazilian midfielder Arthur Melo, 25.
West Ham are considering a move for 26-year-old Burnley midfielder Josh Brownhill.
The Hammers are also plotting a bid for Chelsea striker Armando Broja after the 20-year-old's impressive loan spell at Southampton.
Leicester manager Brendan Rodgers is determined to refresh his squad in a move that could see several first-team players leave the club.
Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel says Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku remains an important part of his plans for next season, despite the 28-year-old being linked with a return to Inter Milan.
Barcelona have reached a breakthrough in their talks with 17-year-old Spain midfielder and Liverpool target Gavi.
Wolves midfielder Ruben Neves would prefer to stay in the Premier League if he leaves Molineux at the end of the season. The Portuguese, 25, has two years left on his contract.
David Beckham wants to bring Al-Rayyan and Colombia midfielder James Rodriguez, 30, to his Inter Miami side.

Arsenal are closing in on a Â£40m deal for Leicester's Belgian midfielder Youri Tielemans but Real Madrid are ready to move for the 25-year-old if the Gunners fail to qualify for the Champions League.
Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo, 37, has discussed his Manchester United future with former boss Sir Alex Ferguson in a series of private meetings.
Tottenham Hotspur are set to sign West Brom and England keeper Sam Johnstone after Manchester United decided not to go ahead with a move.
Tottenham have been given encouragement that Villarreal and Spain centre-back Pau Torres, 25, could be available for Â£10m below his release clause of Â£55m.
Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba has held talks with Juventus over a summer move back to Turin.
Departing Manchester United and Serbia midfielder Nemanja Matic, 33, could join Juventus this summer.
Brentford manager Thomas Frank is keen to have the long-term future of Danish striker Christian Eriksen, 30, decided before the end of the season.
West Ham are the new leaders in the race to sign Blackburn and Chile striker Ben Brereton Diaz, 23.

Interim manager Ralf Rangnick expects the Manchester United squad to be bolstered with the arrival of "six or eight new players" in the summer transfer window alongside the arrival of new boss Erik ten Hag.
Leicester will battle Chelsea for the signature of Torino's Â£40m-rated Brazilian centre-back Gleison Bremer, 25.
Ajax and Argentina defender Nicolas Tagliafico, 29, is still set to leave the Dutch club in the summer, despite his contract running for another year.

Leeds United and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26, says that he is fully concentrated on finishing the Premier League season with his boyhood club amid transfer links to the likes of Aston Villa and Manchester United this summer.
French winger Allan Saint-Maximin, 25, says he does not see himself leaving Newcastle this summer.
Paris St-Germain's Argentine midfielder Leandro Paredes says he "dreams" of playing for Real Madrid.
Liverpool will look to give English defender Joe Gomez a new contract this summer despite ongoing speculation about the 24-year-old's future at the club.
Liverpool are ahead of Real Madrid and Chelsea in the race to sign Monaco's 22-year-old France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni.
Barcelona want to sign 27-year-old Manchester City's Portugal midfielder Bernardo Silva.
Arsenal could be thwarted in their bid to sign 24-year-old Argentina forward Lautaro Martinez with Inter Milan not looking to sell him.
Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester United are looking to sign RB Leipzig's France midfielder Christopher Nkunku, 24, this summer.
Bayern Munich are preparing an opening bid about Â£15m to begin talks with RB Leipzig for 24-year-old Austria midfielder Konrad Laimer.
Manchester United are also interested in Laimer, who has worked previously with interim manager Ralf Rangnick.
Former Manchester United midfielder David Beckham hopes Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo, 37, will remain at Old Trafford next season.
Ronaldo has told his team-mates he will stay at Manchester United if incoming manager Erik ten Hag wants him.
Atletico Madrid are keen on Manchester United's 24-year-old English full-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka.
Aston Villa have held fresh talks over signing Marseille's 22-year-old French midfielder Boubacar Kamara.
Bournemouth want Manchester United's England keeper Dean Henderson, 25, next season.
Former Netherlands midfielder Fred Rutten turned down an offer to become one of Erik ten Hag's assistants at Manchester United and is set to return to PSV Eindhoven.
Tottenham are facing a challenge from Bundesliga and Serie A sides for Hellas Verona's 27-year-old Czech Republic midfielder Antonin Barak.

Leicester City are resigned to losing a host of key players during the summer with clubs circling for 25-year-old Begium midfielder Youri Tielemans, 25-year-old England midfielder James Maddison and 24-year-old England winger Harvey Barnes.
Liverpool are hoping to beat Leeds United to the Â£4m signing of Aberdeen's 19-year-old Scotland defender Calvin Ramsay.
Former Chelsea and Tottenham manager Andre Villas-Boas could become Morocco coach, which may pave the way for Chelsea forward Hakim Ziyech's return to the Morocco fold.
Bayern Munich are planning a summer move for Liverpool and Senegal forward Sadio Mane with the German giants having already made contact with the player's agent.
However, Liverpool have had no contact from the German club. The 30-year-old is out of contract in 2023.
Arsenal are ready to explore a move for England forward Raheem Sterling if Manchester City agree to sell the 27-year-old this summer, when he will have one year left on his contract.
The Gunners have opened talks with 29-year-old Egypt midfielder Mohamed Elneny, whose present deal with them expires in the summer.

Liverpool's Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, 28, fears for his Anfield future, as he has not being approached about a new deal and has not played for the club since 20 March. The English midfielder is under contract until next summer.

France midfielder Paul Pogba, whose contract with Manchester United runs out in the summer, has told Manchester City he does not intend to join them as the 29-year-old is believed to favour an offer from another club.
West Ham are the favourites to sign Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah, 22. The Gunners are keen to keep the Englishman at the club.
Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel is expected to be told that he will receive the backing of the club's incoming owners.

Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe will listen to offers for up to 10 players in the summer including captain Jamaal Lascelles, with the English defender, 28, falling down the pecking order at the club.
Aston Villa have made an initial Â£12m bid to sign Barcelona midfielder Philippe Coutinho on a permanent deal. The 29-year-old Brazilian has been on loan at the Premier League club since January.

Chelsea defender Jake Clarke-Salter, 24, is wanted by Leeds United and PSV Eindhoven after impressing on loan at Championship side Coventry City. The former England Under-21 international is nearing the end of his present deal at Stamford Bridge.
Barcelona boss Xavi says their financial position ruled them out of a move for 21-year-old Norway striker Erling Haaland, who is set to join Manchester City from Borussia Dortmund.
Manchester United have asked their agents to find them the best free transfers this summer.
Red Bull Salzburg and Germany striker Karim Adeyemi, 20, is close to a move to Borussia Dortmund after Manchester United failed in a move, his agent says.

Sunderland are plotting a move to sign Jobe Bellingham - the younger brother of Borussia Dortmund and England midfielder  Jude - from Birmingham. The 16-year-old England youth international became the Blues second-youngest debutant in January, with the record held by his sibling.
Championship side Birmingham City are close to being bought by a British businessman, while the position of the club's manager, Lee Bowyer, is under threat.
Middlesbrough are prepared to let English keepers Joe Lumley, 27, and Luke Daniels, 34, leave during the summer, with both players having a year left on their contracts with the club.
Newcastle United have made contact with Philippe Coutinho in a bid to thwart Aston Villa's attempts to sign the 29-year-old Brazil attacking midfielder on a permanent deal from Barcelona.
West Ham are lining up a summer move for Aston Villa and England striker Ollie Watkins, 26, with the Midlands club likely to demand a Â£50m fee.

Barcelona are targeting Liverpool forward Sadio Mane, who has been linked with Bayern Munich. The 30-year-old Senegal international is reportedly interested in a move to the Nou Camp to improve his chances of winning the Ballon d'Or.
But former Liverpool striker Jamie Carragher has joked that Mane will have him "to deal with" if he moves away.
Arsenal have put a former player of theirs, Bayern Munich and Germany winger Serge Gnabry, 26, on a shortlist of targets this summer.

Barca are also ready to offer Chelsea captain Cesar Azpilicueta Â£11m a year in wages, but are hampered by financial fair play rules so cannot offer any significant transfer fee for the 32-year-old Spain defender.
Tottenham and Spain left-back Sergio Reguilon, 25, is also a Barcelona target.
Chelsea and Manchester United are keen on signing RB Leipzig and France attacker Christopher Nkunku, 24.

Real Madrid have added a Â£340m buyout clause to Antonio Rudiger's contract after the 29-year-old Germany defender signed a four-year deal with the Spanish giants worth Â£315,000 a week, on a free transfer from Chelsea.

Leicester City expect Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans to leave the club this summer and the Foxes are prepared to listen to offers of Â£40m for the 25-year-old, whose contract runs out in summer 2023.

Arsenal are one of the clubs being linked with Tielemans but their hopes of signing him are set to depend on whether they can finish in the Premier League top four and secure a Champions League berth.
Manchester United and Newcastle United are interested in signing Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen but Napoli want at least 100m euros (Â£85.5m) for the 23-year-old.
Lazio president Claudio Lotito says he turned down a 140m euro (Â£120m) offer 27-year-old Serbia midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, a target for Manchester United and Paris St-Germain.
Manchester United are ready to meet the Â£38m asking price for Sporting Lisbon's Portuguese defender Goncalo Inacio, 20.
Sevilla could sign Arsenal winger Nicolas Pepe, 26, in the summer, with the Ivory Coast international valued at around Â£25m.
AC Milan are interested in Arsenal and France defender William Saliba, 21, who is on loan at Marseille.
Despite reports that the Gunners have begun talks with 29-year-old Egypt midfielder Mohamed Elneny, counter reports claim he has agreed a deal in principle with Galatasaray.

France midfielder Paul Pogba will have to take a pay cut if he rejoins Italian club Juventus when his contract at Manchester United runs out in the summer. Paris St-Germain have offered the 29-year-old more, while Real Madrid are monitoring the player's situation.
Leeds United and Brazil winger Raphinha, 25, has given Barcelona his word that he will agree a move to the Nou Camp if Jesse Marsch's side are relegated.

Tottenham look likely to beat Manchester United to the signature of West Bromwich Albion goalkeeper Sam Johnstone, 29. The England international, who started his career at Old Trafford, would be back-up to Hugo Lloris at Spurs.
Spurs are also considering offering former Manchester City and Ivory Coast midfielder Yaya Toure, 38, a coaching role when he completes his Uefa badges.
Manchester United are getting close to agreeing a contract with Ajax assistant manager Mitchell van der Gaag to join Erik ten Hag at Old Trafford

Juventus are ready to offer Manchester United and France midfielder Paul Pogba Â£8m a year - which is around Â£160,000 a week - plus a huge bonus package and signing-on fees. Pogba's contract runs out this summer and Manchester City are reportedly interested in the 29-year-old.
Chelsea are keen on Barcelona and United States defender Sergino Dest, 21.
The agent of Brazil and Manchester City forward Gabriel Jesus has confirmed that the 25-year-old has held talks with Arsenal over a possible transfer.
Manchester United's summer transfer plans are in disarray after three midfield transfer targets for the summer have rejected a move to Old Trafford.
Tottenham are interested in three Everton players, including Brazilian forward Richarlison, 25, English winger Anthony Gordon, 21, and 24-year-old English defender Ben Godfrey.
Spurs are also keen on Leicester and Belgium midfielder Youri Tielemans, 25.

Dimitar Berbatov has told his old club Tottenham not to be fixated on just keeping England captain Harry Kane, 28, this summer, because top clubs will be eyeing South Korea forward Son Heung-min Heung, 29, too.
Manchester United have been told they will have to pay Â£85.5m if they want to sign Nigeria striker Victor Osimhen, 23, from Napoli this summer.
West Ham have offered 23-year-old England midfielder Declan Rice, who is a Chelsea and Manchester United target, an eight year contract worth Â£200,000 a week to remain with the club.
However, Rice will not accept West Ham's offer.
Meanwhile the Hammers want to sign Aston Villa and England forward Ollie Watkins, 26.
Wolves have identified Sporting Lisbon and Portugal player Joao Palhinha, 26, as a potential signing if 35-year-old Portugal midfielder Joao Moutinho leaves.
Aston Villa are close to announcing the permanent signing of Brazil and Barcelona playmaker Philippe Coutinho, 29, who has been on loan at Villa Park since January.
Everton are considering a summer move for Manchester City and Republic of Ireland goalkeeper Gavin Bazunu, 20.
Leicester are keen to sign Club Bruges and Belgium midfielder Charles de Ketelaere, 21.
Manchester United will have to pay RB Leipzig and Austria forward Konrad Laimer's Â£34m release clause if they want to sign the 24-year-old.
Southampton are considering making a move for Fiorentina and Poland keeper Bartlomiej Dragowski, 24.
Crystal Palace want to sign Chelsea and England midfielder Conor Gallagher, 22, on a permanent basis after he won the club's Player of the Season award while on loan with the club.
Former Manchester United and England midfielder Michael Carrick, 40, is favourite to be the next Lincoln City manager.
Newcastle will make a summer bid for Everton and England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, 25, as a priority target. The Magpies have held a prolonged interest in the player, as have Arsenal.

Bayern Munich have joined the race for Manchester United's soon-to-be free agent Paul Pogba, with Juventus, Paris St-Germain, Real Madrid and Manchester City already in the hunt for the 29-year-old France midfielder's signature.
Robert Lewandowski, 33, will not sign a new contract at Bayern Munich, and the Poland striker could be sold to Barcelona this summer before he enters the final year of his contract.
Chelsea want to complete the signing of Sevilla and France defender Jules Kounde, 23, early in the summer window.

Manager Pep Guardiola will run down his contract at Manchester City, which expires in 2023, rather than signing an extension this summer. The Spaniard will make a "last-minute" decision on an extension.

Manchester City and England attacking midfielder Raheem Sterling, 27, expects to join one of Europe's elite clubs if he leaves the Etihad in the summer, despite strong interest from Arsenal and Tottenham.
West Ham will not hold further talks with England midfielder Declan Rice until the summer transfer window has closed after the 23-year-old turned down an eight-year contract worth Â£83m.
Aston Villa are lining up a move for Leeds and England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26.
But West Ham boss David Moyes wants to unite Phillips with his England central midfielder Rice at London Stadium.
Newcastle are keeping tabs on Leicester and Denmark goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel, 35.

Manchester United are monitoring Barcelona and Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong's situation at the Nou Camp but Barca have put a Â£70m price tag on the 25-year-old, who favours a move to a side in the Champions League.
If Barca do lose De Jong in the summer, manager Xavi would look to replace him with Manchester City's Portugal midfielder Bernardo Silva, 27.
Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 28, wants to stay at Chelsea this summer despite an underwhelming time at Stamford Bridge since his move from Inter Milan last summer.
Newly promoted Bournemouth are in talks with Liverpool over a permanent deal for English centre-back Nathaniel Phillips, 25.
Liverpool and England defender Joe Gomez, 24, is wanted by Aston Villa manger Steven Gerrard this summer.
Jurgen Klopp has given the green light for Liverpool to battle Leeds United to sign Aberdeen's Scottish defender Calvin Ramsay, 18.

Arsenal winger Reiss Nelson, 22, will hold talks with Mikel Arteta about his future after a year-long loan at Feyenoord. Other Premier League clubs are interested in the Englishman, but the Gunners remain his priority.
Tottenham are preparing an opening bid for Portugal defensive midfielder Joao Palhinha, 26, with his club Sporting Lisbon valuing him at Â£25m.
West Ham retain an interesting in signing Manchester United and England forward Jesse Lingard, 29, who spent a season on loan with the Hammers and is out of contract this summer.
Real Madrid are "more confident than ever" they can set out a deal to secure France and Paris St-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe, but the 23-year-old has yet to decide where his future lies.

Barcelona are not interested in Antoine Griezmann, 31, returning to the club if Atletico Madrid decide not to keep the France forward who is on loan from Barca. Meanwhile, Barca's number one target is Bayern Munich and Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 33.
However, Bayern Munich president Herbert Hainer says Lewandowski has a contract with the Bundesliga champions until June 2023 - and the 33-year-old "will fulfil it".
Chelsea have reached an initial agreement to sign Croatia winger Ivan Perisic, 33, on a free transfer from Inter Milan.

Barcelona and Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 25, looks set to reject a move to Manchester United, while incoming boss Erik ten Hag intends to get tough on those players who want to leave Old Trafford this summer.

England midfielder Jude Bellingham, 18, has addressed transfer speculation linking him with a move to either Manchester United or Liverpool by confirming he will be playing for Borussia Dortmund next season.
