Chelsea players whose contracts are expiring soon want to hear the plans of the club's prospective new owners before signing new deals.
Newcastle United are weighing up a club record move for 24-year-old Brazil midfielder Lucas Paqueta, who plays for French club Lyon.
Tottenham are monitoring Italy and Inter Milan centre-back Alessandro Bastoni, 23, with Manchester United also interested.
English goalkeeper Fraser Forster, 34, has undergone a medical at Hotspur Way ahead of completing his move to Spurs when his Southampton contract expires next month.
Arsenal are keeping an eye on Alvaro Morata's situation. The Spain striker, 29, has spent the season on loan at Juventus from Atletico Madrid.
Gunners target Tammy Abraham says he is 'more than happy' at Roma but the 24-year-old England striker has refused to rule out a return to the Premier League this summer.
Arsenal are also interested in re-signing Germany winger Serge Gnabry from Bayern Munich but are unable to afford the 26-year-old this summer.
Arsenal have offered 22-year-old English striker Eddie Nketiah a final contract offer - and there is a growing feeling he will sign to stay on beyond his current deal which runs out in the summer.

Real Madrid are believed to be ready to offer up to 120m euros (Â£102m) for 22-year-old AC Milan and Portugal forward Rafael Leao, whose contract runs out in June 2024 and includes a 150m euro (Â£128m) release clause.
Barcelona have yet to reach an agreement about extending France forward Ousmane Dembele's contract, with the 25-year-old's deal running out this summer.
Aston Villa are ready to step up their pursuit of 22-year-old Rangers and Nigeria defender Calvin Bassey.
Barcelona have met with the agent of Villa's England Under-19 international midfielder Carney Chukwuemeka, 18.
Paris St-Germain would be willing to sell Brazil forward Neymar, 30, if they receive an acceptable offer this summer.
Liverpool have put England midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, 28, up for sale with Aston Villa and West Ham among those interested.
Talks between West Ham and Czech midfielder Tomas Soucek, 27, over a new contract have reached an impasse.
Everton and Crystal Palace are eyeing Brazilian midfielder Ederson Silva, 22, who plays for Serie A club Salernitana.
Everton's 25-year-old English defender Jonjoe Kenny, who is out of contract in the summer, has dropped a hint on his future and said 'a lot is possible' this summer.
German midfielder Pascal Gross, 30, is in advanced talks over a new contract at Brighton with his current deal set to run out in June.

Manchester United have told Barcelona and Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 25, they will turn their attention elsewhere if he cannot decide whether he wants to come to Old Trafford this summer.

Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni's proposed move to Real Madrid has been held up due to a tax issue. The La Liga champions are prepared to pay around 80m euros (Â£68m) for the 22-year-old French international.
Manchester United, Liverpool, Arsenal and Chelsea are all keen on Tchouameni and will be ready to step in if his transfer to Madrid does not materialise.

AC Milan want to tie Portugal forward Rafael Leao, 22, down to a new deal to rebuff interest from Real Madrid. The Spanish side are looking for a forward after French international Kylian Mbappe, 23, pledged his future to Paris St-Germain.
Real Madrid want a midfielder and striker this summer and will discuss potential new signings at a meeting on their return to Spain from the Champions League final against Liverpool on Saturday.
Everton forward Richarlison, 25, could leave Goodison Park this summer with Tottenham, Real Madrid and Paris St-Germain all keen on the Brazil international.
Everton are competing with West Ham to sign Burnley and Ivory Coast forward Maxwel Cornet, 25, after the Clarets' relegation from the Premier League.
Tottenham striker Harry Kane is ready to open talks on a new contract with the club, despite the 28-year-old England captain pushing for a move to Manchester City last summer.

Inter Milan are hoping to sign Henrikh Mkhitaryan, 33, when his current deal with Roma ends in the summer. The Armenia midfielder is also considering an offer from the Europa Conference League winners.
Arsenal are interested in Lens midfielder Cheick Doucoure, 22. However, Brighton, Everton, Crystal Palace and Wolves are also keeping tabs on the Mali international.
Arsenal are also considering a move for 25-year-old Manchester City and Ukraine left-back Oleksandr Zinchenko.

Leicester City are set to give Northern Ireland defender Jonny Evans, 34, a new one-year deal. However, they will listen to offers for Denmark centre-back Jannik Vestergaard, 29, and French midfielder Boubakary Soumare, 23, as Brendan Rodgers looks to shake up his squad.
Manchester United could make an offer for Liverpool and Chelsea target Christopher Nkunku next week, with the 24-year-old France forward reluctant to sign a new deal at RB Lepizig.
Paris St-Germain will not sign Barcelona winger Ousmane Dembele, 25, this summer despite the French international being heavily linked with a return to his homeland.
Manchester United have held internal talks with new manager Erik ten Hag about Ajax's Netherlands defender Jurrien Timber, 20, and Villareal's Spain centre back Pau Torres, 25.

Paul Pogba's barber has dropped a clue on  about the 29-year-old midfielder's future, suggesting the Frenchman will rejoin Juventus when his contract at Manchester United expires in the summer. (Manchester Evening News)external-link
West Ham will listen to offers for Czech Republic midfielder Tomas Soucek, 27, this summer following a reported falling-out with manager David Moyes.
Crystal Palace are looking at a move for 29-year-old England keeper Sam Johnstone, who is leaving West Brom when his contract expires this summer.
Manchester United made an enquiry about Tottenham's English forward Dane Scarlett last month but were told the 18-year-old had signed a contract extension with the London club.

Fiorentina are struggling to agree a deal to sign Arsenal midfielder Lucas Torreira. The Uruguay midfielder, 26, has impressed on loan with the Italian side who are hoping the Gunners will reduce their Â£12.5m asking price.

Everton's move for Blackpool's Welsh goalkeeper Chris Maxwell, 31, as back-up for Jordan Pickford, is dependent on their third-choice, Portuguese 22-year-old Joao Virginia, completing a permanent move or another loan deal to Sporting Lisbon.
Manchester United are on the verge of making a final push to sign Wolves' Portuguese forward Ruben Neves, 25, although they face competition from Barcelona.
The Red Devils fear being priced out of a move for Darwin Nunez with Benfica having told United it will cost them about Â£100m to sign the 22-year-old Uruguay international.
United have also consulted Erik ten Hag on the possibility of signing Villarreal's Spanish defender Pau Torres, 25, in the summer transfer window.

Chelsea are expected to target defenders with their rumoured Â£200m transfer budget, with four set to leave the club this summer. They could rival Manchester City and Tottenham for Brighton and Spain's Â£45m-rated left-back Marc Cucurella, 23, while RB Leipzig's French winger Christopher Nkunku, 24, is another target.
Liverpool will receive around Â£25m for the transfer of Sadio Mane to Bayern Munich, with the Senegal striker, 30, being lined up to replace Robert Lewandowski.

Aston Villa are exploring the possibility of signing Luis Suarez, 35, who is a free agent after being released by Atletico Madrid. The Uruguay forward is a former team-mate of Villa boss Steven Gerrard.

Paris St-Germain have made Neymar, 30, available for transfer this summer. The Brazil international joined the French club for a world record 222m euros (Â£200m) in 2017 but has seen his appearances limited by recurring injuries.
The Ligue 1 champions have been offered Arsenal and Ivory Coast winger Nicolas Pepe, 26, by the north London club.

Burnley and Ivory Coast forward Maxwel Cornet, 25, is attracting huge interest after a Â£17.5m clause in his contract was triggered by the club's relegation to the Championship. West Ham are interested as David Moyes looks to bolster his squad ahead of another European campaign while Newcastle, Brighton, Everton, Wolves, Crystal Palace, Leicester and Fulham have also contacted Cornet's representatives.
Newcastle want to add Bayer Leverkusen winger Moussa Diaby, 22, to their attack next season and have made enquiries over a deal for the France international.

Gabriel Jesus' agent, Marcelo Pettinati, has claimed talks will progress over the Manchester City and Brazil forward's future after the international break in June amid rumours linking the 25-year-old with a move to Arsenal and Tottenham.
The Gunners' hunt for a striker is between Jesus and Spanish striker Alvaro Morata, 29, who spent this season on loan at Italian club Juventus from Atletico Madrid.

Atletico Madrid have turned down the chance to sign Gareth Bale and Angel di Maria this summer. Welsh forward Bale, 32, is set to leave Real Madrid when his contract expires in June, while Argentine winger Di Maria, 34, is leaving Paris St-Germain on a free transfer.
Sevilla have no intention of accepting less than 65m euros (Â£55m) for 23-year-old French defender Jules Kounde, with Chelsea expected to make their opening bid soon.
However, Chelsea are hopeful that a bid in the region of Â£42 million with the possibility of add-ons will be enough to land the Frenchman.

Croatian midfielder Ivan Perisic, 33, has agreed terms on a two-year deal with Tottenham, with sources close to the Inter Milan player believing the London club will beat both Chelsea and Juventus to his signature.
Roma are willing to offer a new contract to England forward Tammy Abraham, 24, with Arsenal, Newcastle and Aston Villa all asking about his availability.
Serie A runners-up Inter Milan are demanding in excess of Â£20m for 24-year-old Italian left-back Federico Dimarco, who is a target for Arsenal.
However, Arsenal are set to be challenged by north London rivals Tottenham for Middlesbrough's English right-back Djed Spence, 21, who spent this season on loan at Nottingham Forest.

Newcastle and Leeds are hoping to sign defender Nathan Collins, 21, from Burnley, with the Clarets facing a battle to keep hold of their Republic of Ireland international following relegation from the Premier League.
Newcastle could beat Everton and West Ham to another Burnley player in James Tarkowski, 29, with the England defender out of contract at the end of June.

Crystal Palace are in advanced talks over a move for England goalkeeper Sam Johnstone. The 29-year-old is a free agent after leaving West Brom and has been interesting former club Manchester United and Tottenham in recent months.
West Ham are not looking to sell the Czech Republic midfielder Tomas Soucek, 27, this summer amid reports they were listening to offers for him.

Chelsea are facing a decision on their talented 19-year-old English defender Levi Colwill - currently on loan at Huddersfield - as Arsenal, Leicester and several other Premier League clubs have made inquiries over a summer move.
Manchester United are considering a bid for 31-year-old Chelsea and France midfielder N'Golo Kante.
Liverpool have made contact with 25-year-old France winger Ousmane Dembele, whose Barcelona deal expires this summer.
Manchester United are prepared to make Barcelona midfielder Frenkie de Jong, 25, their highest paid player with a weekly salary of Â£395,000.
Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag wants to sign 20-year-old Ajax defender Jurrien Timber and 22-year-old Benfica striker Darwin Nunez.
Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel will hold talks with Conor Gallagher, 22, before deciding on his future. The England midfielder spent last season on loan at Crystal Palace. ()
Manchester City's Germany midfielder Ilkay Gundogan, 31, is set to discuss his future with the club. ()
Potential new Burnley boss Vincent Kompany wants to make English centre-back Taylor Harwood-Bellis, 20, his first signing on loan from former club Manchester City. ()
Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, 35, says he has been left with a "bitter taste" in an open letter to Manchester United after his departure. ()
Inter Milan's Croatia winger Ivan Perisic, 33, is set to sign for Tottenham on a free transfer and the deal could be announced next week. ()

Roma boss Jose Mourinho is hoping to beat former clubs Tottenham and Manchester United to the signing of Argentina striker Paulo Dybala, 28, on a free transfer after he leaves Juventus this summer. ()
Paris St-Germain are keen to sign Brazil forward Richarlison, 25, from Everton this summer. ()
Leeds winger Raphinha's father says "possibilities exist" over his future as the 25-year-old Brazil international continues to be linked with Barcelona. ()
Juventus have offered Argentina winger Angel di Maria, 34, a one-year contract after he decided to leave Paris St-Germain at the end of this season. ()
Manchester City's Japanese defender Ko Itakura, 25, is attracting interest from Bournemouth and Fulham after an impressive loan spell at Schalke. ()
Liverpool's Senegal striker Sadio Mane, 30, will tell the club he wants to leave this summer.
Bayern Munich are close to agreeing a deal worth Â£34m for Liverpool's Mane.
Liverpool have made contact with the representatives of Barcelona's France winger Ousmane Dembele, 25.
Barcelona's Dembele is also being pursued by Chelsea.
Liverpool were considering a bid for Tottenham's South Korea forward Son Heung-min, 29, if Spurs failed to finish in the Premier League top four .
Manchester City forward Gabriel Jesus, 25, will resolve his future after returning from Brazil duty amid interest from Arsenal.
Villarreal and Spain defender Pau Torres, 25, is edging closer to a move to Manchester United after his agents travelled to England to continue discussions.
West Ham and Southampton are monitoring developments with 20-year-old Red Bull Salzburg and Austria striker Junior Adamu.
Leicester City are interested in signing Manchester United's English midfielder James Garner, 21, after he impressed on loan at Nottingham Forest.
Arsenal have quoted Benfica Â£8.5m for 30-year-old Germany goalkeeper Bernd Leno.
Leeds United's Brazil forward Raphinha, 25, may favour a move to Manchester United over Barcelona.
Bournemouth and Rangers are interested in 29-year-old Crystal Palace and England goalkeeper Jack Butland.
Aston Villa and Southampton are among a group of clubs chasing Peterborough's 19-year-old English defender Ronnie Edwards.
Tottenham have told Villarreal they want Â£17m for 26-year-old Argentina midfielder Giovani lo Celso.
Paris St-Germain are keen on signing Everton's 25-year-old Brazil forward Richarlison.
Barcelona are interested in Sevilla and France's Jules Kounde, 23, or Napoli and Senegal's Kalidou Koulibaly, 30, as a new centre-back.
Manchester United have started talks to sign 20-year-old Dutch international defender Jurrien Timber, who is valued at Â£43m by Ajax.
Senegal striker Sadio Mane, 30, has not told Liverpool he wants to leave the club amid links with a Â£35m move to Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich.

Benfica striker Darwin Nunez, 22, has been meeting with some of the Premier League's top sides about a possible summer move. Liverpool, Manchester United and Newcastle are all interested in the Uruguayan.
Manchester City are looking at signing Brighton's 23-year-old Spanish left-back Marc Cucurella and Leeds' England midfielder Kalvin Phillips, 26.
Brazil forward Richarlison is considering his future at Everton, with Chelsea, Tottenham and Arsenal showing an interest in the 25-year-old.
Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku, 29, also plans to hold talks with Chelsea about his future after American investor Todd Boehly completed his Â£4.25bn purchase of the club.
West Ham are willing to sell French defender Issa Diop, 25, who has slipped to fourth choice under boss David Moyes.
Premier League champions Manchester City are monitoring Leicester City's highly rated England U18s defender Ben Nelson, 18.
Real Madrid have stepped up their attempts to sign Monaco's French midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni, 22, with a bid worth around Â£68m.
Tchouameni has agreed a five-year deal with Real Madrid as negotiations over the fee continue.
Brazil forward Neymar, 30, is planning to stay with Paris St-Germain, despite speculation over his future with the French champions.
Inter Milan chief executive Beppe Marotta hopes the club can sign 28-year-old Argentina forward Paulo Dybala, who is leaving Juventus when his contract runs out this summer.
La Liga side Sevilla are considering joining the race to sign Spurs and England midfielder Harry Winks, 26.
Former Chelsea and Arsenal winger Willian, 33, is keen to leave his native Brazil, where he currently plays for Corinthians, and return to play in Europe.
Lens and Mali midfielder Cheick Doucoure, 22, is a prime summer target for Crystal Palace manager Patrick Vieira.
Barcelona are looking to offload Danish forward Martin Braithwaite on a loan deal this summer, but the 30-year-old is reluctant to move on.
Nottingham Forest are keen to keep on-loan Middlesbrough defender Djed Spence but Tottenham, Arsenal and Brentford are also looking at the 21-year-old Englishman.
Manchester United are considering a shock move for Chelsea and England midfielder Mason Mount, 23, who is yet to sign a new contract at Stamford Bridge.
Liverpool are tracking Rennes' French forward Martin Terrier, 25, as a replacement for Sadio Mane, should the Senegal international, 30, depart Anfield.
Manchester United are pursuing a deal for Benfica's Uruguayan striker Darwin Nunez, 22, who is rated at Â£68m.
Newcastle are set to make a bid for Everton striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, with Manchester United and Arsenal also expressing an interest in the 25-year-old England international.
Real Madrid are close to agreeing a deal with Monaco for 22-year-old France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni, who has turned down offers from Liverpool and Paris St-Germain.
Manchester United's hopes of signing Frenkie de Jong look to be over after the 25-year-old Netherlands midfielder opted to stay at Barcelona.
Tottenham will rival Nottingham Forest for the signature of Middlesbrough's 21-year-old England U21 full-back Djed Spence, who spent last season on loan at the City Ground.
Barcelona boss Xavi has held talks with Wolves and Portugal midfielder Ruben Neves, 25, over a potential transfer.
Juventus remain keen on Manchester City's Spanish defender Aymeric Laporte, 28.
Manchester City's Ukraine left-back Oleksandr Zinchenko, 25, is attracting interest from both Everton and Newcastle.
West Ham are closing in on a deal to sign Rennes defender Nayef Aguerd. The Hammers also tried to sign the 26-year-old Moroccan last summer.
Arsenal remain interested in Leicester midfielder Youri Tielemans with the 25-year-old Belgian expected to leave the club this summer, but two other clubs are also in the race.
Chelsea have reignited their interest in 21-year-old Barcelona and USA full-back Sergino Dest.
Miguel Almiron's agent insists the 28-year-old Paraguayan forward will not be leaving Newcastle United this summer, with his release clause reportedly set at Â£60m.
Inter Milan are to hold talks with the lawyers of Chelsea striker Romelu Lukaku, 29, to explore a return to Serie A for the Belgium international.
Georgian goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili, 21, who is currently at Valencia, is on the radar of Tottenham.
Leeds United face a Â£10m battle with Bundesliga side Borussia Dortmund to sign Denmark international right-back Rasmus Kristensen, 24, from Red Bull Salzburg.
Brentford are also lining up a move for Kristensen to add to their Danish contingent.
Liverpool are set to beat Leeds to the signing of 18-year-old Scottish defender Calvin Ramsay from Aberdeen.
Barcelona have made France international defender Clement Lenglet, 26, available for loan with a number of Premier League clubs interested.
